## File: .specify/scripts/powershell/create-new-feature.ps1
````powershell
  1: #!/usr/bin/env pwsh
  2: # Create a new feature
  3: [CmdletBinding()]
  4: param(
  5:     [switch]$Json,
  6:     [string]$ShortName,
  7:     [int]$Number = 0,
  8:     [switch]$Help,
  9:     [Parameter(ValueFromRemainingArguments = $true)]
 10:     [string[]]$FeatureDescription
 11: )
 12: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
 13: 
 14: # Show help if requested
 15: if ($Help) {
 16:     Write-Host "Usage: ./create-new-feature.ps1 [-Json] [-ShortName <name>] [-Number N] <feature description>"
 17:     Write-Host ""
 18:     Write-Host "Options:"
 19:     Write-Host "  -Json               Output in JSON format"
 20:     Write-Host "  -ShortName <name>   Provide a custom short name (2-4 words) for the branch"
 21:     Write-Host "  -Number N           Specify branch number manually (overrides auto-detection)"
 22:     Write-Host "  -Help               Show this help message"
 23:     Write-Host ""
 24:     Write-Host "Examples:"
 25:     Write-Host "  ./create-new-feature.ps1 'Add user authentication system' -ShortName 'user-auth'"
 26:     Write-Host "  ./create-new-feature.ps1 'Implement OAuth2 integration for API'"
 27:     exit 0
 28: }
 29: 
 30: # Check if feature description provided
 31: if (-not $FeatureDescription -or $FeatureDescription.Count -eq 0) {
 32:     Write-Error "Usage: ./create-new-feature.ps1 [-Json] [-ShortName <name>] <feature description>"
 33:     exit 1
 34: }
 35: 
 36: $featureDesc = ($FeatureDescription -join ' ').Trim()
 37: 
 38: # Resolve repository root. Prefer git information when available, but fall back
 39: # to searching for repository markers so the workflow still functions in repositories that
 40: # were initialized with --no-git.
 41: function Find-RepositoryRoot {
 42:     param(
 43:         [string]$StartDir,
 44:         [string[]]$Markers = @('.git', '.specify')
 45:     )
 46:     $current = Resolve-Path $StartDir
 47:     while ($true) {
 48:         foreach ($marker in $Markers) {
 49:             if (Test-Path (Join-Path $current $marker)) {
 50:                 return $current
 51:             }
 52:         }
 53:         $parent = Split-Path $current -Parent
 54:         if ($parent -eq $current) {
 55:             # Reached filesystem root without finding markers
 56:             return $null
 57:         }
 58:         $current = $parent
 59:     }
 60: }
 61: 
 62: function Get-HighestNumberFromSpecs {
 63:     param([string]$SpecsDir)
 64:     
 65:     $highest = 0
 66:     if (Test-Path $SpecsDir) {
 67:         Get-ChildItem -Path $SpecsDir -Directory | ForEach-Object {
 68:             if ($_.Name -match '^(\d+)') {
 69:                 $num = [int]$matches[1]
 70:                 if ($num -gt $highest) { $highest = $num }
 71:             }
 72:         }
 73:     }
 74:     return $highest
 75: }
 76: 
 77: function Get-HighestNumberFromBranches {
 78:     param()
 79:     
 80:     $highest = 0
 81:     try {
 82:         $branches = git branch -a 2>$null
 83:         if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
 84:             foreach ($branch in $branches) {
 85:                 # Clean branch name: remove leading markers and remote prefixes
 86:                 $cleanBranch = $branch.Trim() -replace '^\*?\s+', '' -replace '^remotes/[^/]+/', ''
 87:                 
 88:                 # Extract feature number if branch matches pattern ###-*
 89:                 if ($cleanBranch -match '^(\d+)-') {
 90:                     $num = [int]$matches[1]
 91:                     if ($num -gt $highest) { $highest = $num }
 92:                 }
 93:             }
 94:         }
 95:     } catch {
 96:         # If git command fails, return 0
 97:         Write-Verbose "Could not check Git branches: $_"
 98:     }
 99:     return $highest
100: }
101: 
102: function Get-NextBranchNumber {
103:     param(
104:         [string]$SpecsDir
105:     )
106: 
107:     # Fetch all remotes to get latest branch info (suppress errors if no remotes)
108:     try {
109:         git fetch --all --prune 2>$null | Out-Null
110:     } catch {
111:         # Ignore fetch errors
112:     }
113: 
114:     # Get highest number from ALL branches (not just matching short name)
115:     $highestBranch = Get-HighestNumberFromBranches
116: 
117:     # Get highest number from ALL specs (not just matching short name)
118:     $highestSpec = Get-HighestNumberFromSpecs -SpecsDir $SpecsDir
119: 
120:     # Take the maximum of both
121:     $maxNum = [Math]::Max($highestBranch, $highestSpec)
122: 
123:     # Return next number
124:     return $maxNum + 1
125: }
126: 
127: function ConvertTo-CleanBranchName {
128:     param([string]$Name)
129:     
130:     return $Name.ToLower() -replace '[^a-z0-9]', '-' -replace '-{2,}', '-' -replace '^-', '' -replace '-$', ''
131: }
132: $fallbackRoot = (Find-RepositoryRoot -StartDir $PSScriptRoot)
133: if (-not $fallbackRoot) {
134:     Write-Error "Error: Could not determine repository root. Please run this script from within the repository."
135:     exit 1
136: }
137: 
138: try {
139:     $repoRoot = git rev-parse --show-toplevel 2>$null
140:     if ($LASTEXITCODE -eq 0) {
141:         $hasGit = $true
142:     } else {
143:         throw "Git not available"
144:     }
145: } catch {
146:     $repoRoot = $fallbackRoot
147:     $hasGit = $false
148: }
149: 
150: Set-Location $repoRoot
151: 
152: $specsDir = Join-Path $repoRoot 'specs'
153: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $specsDir -Force | Out-Null
154: 
155: # Function to generate branch name with stop word filtering and length filtering
156: function Get-BranchName {
157:     param([string]$Description)
158:     
159:     # Common stop words to filter out
160:     $stopWords = @(
161:         'i', 'a', 'an', 'the', 'to', 'for', 'of', 'in', 'on', 'at', 'by', 'with', 'from',
162:         'is', 'are', 'was', 'were', 'be', 'been', 'being', 'have', 'has', 'had',
163:         'do', 'does', 'did', 'will', 'would', 'should', 'could', 'can', 'may', 'might', 'must', 'shall',
164:         'this', 'that', 'these', 'those', 'my', 'your', 'our', 'their',
165:         'want', 'need', 'add', 'get', 'set'
166:     )
167:     
168:     # Convert to lowercase and extract words (alphanumeric only)
169:     $cleanName = $Description.ToLower() -replace '[^a-z0-9\s]', ' '
170:     $words = $cleanName -split '\s+' | Where-Object { $_ }
171:     
172:     # Filter words: remove stop words and words shorter than 3 chars (unless they're uppercase acronyms in original)
173:     $meaningfulWords = @()
174:     foreach ($word in $words) {
175:         # Skip stop words
176:         if ($stopWords -contains $word) { continue }
177:         
178:         # Keep words that are length >= 3 OR appear as uppercase in original (likely acronyms)
179:         if ($word.Length -ge 3) {
180:             $meaningfulWords += $word
181:         } elseif ($Description -match "\b$($word.ToUpper())\b") {
182:             # Keep short words if they appear as uppercase in original (likely acronyms)
183:             $meaningfulWords += $word
184:         }
185:     }
186:     
187:     # If we have meaningful words, use first 3-4 of them
188:     if ($meaningfulWords.Count -gt 0) {
189:         $maxWords = if ($meaningfulWords.Count -eq 4) { 4 } else { 3 }
190:         $result = ($meaningfulWords | Select-Object -First $maxWords) -join '-'
191:         return $result
192:     } else {
193:         # Fallback to original logic if no meaningful words found
194:         $result = ConvertTo-CleanBranchName -Name $Description
195:         $fallbackWords = ($result -split '-') | Where-Object { $_ } | Select-Object -First 3
196:         return [string]::Join('-', $fallbackWords)
197:     }
198: }
199: 
200: # Generate branch name
201: if ($ShortName) {
202:     # Use provided short name, just clean it up
203:     $branchSuffix = ConvertTo-CleanBranchName -Name $ShortName
204: } else {
205:     # Generate from description with smart filtering
206:     $branchSuffix = Get-BranchName -Description $featureDesc
207: }
208: 
209: # Determine branch number
210: if ($Number -eq 0) {
211:     if ($hasGit) {
212:         # Check existing branches on remotes
213:         $Number = Get-NextBranchNumber -SpecsDir $specsDir
214:     } else {
215:         # Fall back to local directory check
216:         $Number = (Get-HighestNumberFromSpecs -SpecsDir $specsDir) + 1
217:     }
218: }
219: 
220: $featureNum = ('{0:000}' -f $Number)
221: $branchName = "$featureNum-$branchSuffix"
222: 
223: # GitHub enforces a 244-byte limit on branch names
224: # Validate and truncate if necessary
225: $maxBranchLength = 244
226: if ($branchName.Length -gt $maxBranchLength) {
227:     # Calculate how much we need to trim from suffix
228:     # Account for: feature number (3) + hyphen (1) = 4 chars
229:     $maxSuffixLength = $maxBranchLength - 4
230:     
231:     # Truncate suffix
232:     $truncatedSuffix = $branchSuffix.Substring(0, [Math]::Min($branchSuffix.Length, $maxSuffixLength))
233:     # Remove trailing hyphen if truncation created one
234:     $truncatedSuffix = $truncatedSuffix -replace '-$', ''
235:     
236:     $originalBranchName = $branchName
237:     $branchName = "$featureNum-$truncatedSuffix"
238:     
239:     Write-Warning "[specify] Branch name exceeded GitHub's 244-byte limit"
240:     Write-Warning "[specify] Original: $originalBranchName ($($originalBranchName.Length) bytes)"
241:     Write-Warning "[specify] Truncated to: $branchName ($($branchName.Length) bytes)"
242: }
243: 
244: if ($hasGit) {
245:     try {
246:         git checkout -b $branchName | Out-Null
247:     } catch {
248:         Write-Warning "Failed to create git branch: $branchName"
249:     }
250: } else {
251:     Write-Warning "[specify] Warning: Git repository not detected; skipped branch creation for $branchName"
252: }
253: 
254: $featureDir = Join-Path $specsDir $branchName
255: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $featureDir -Force | Out-Null
256: 
257: $template = Join-Path $repoRoot '.specify/templates/spec-template.md'
258: $specFile = Join-Path $featureDir 'spec.md'
259: if (Test-Path $template) { 
260:     Copy-Item $template $specFile -Force 
261: } else { 
262:     New-Item -ItemType File -Path $specFile | Out-Null 
263: }
264: 
265: # Set the SPECIFY_FEATURE environment variable for the current session
266: $env:SPECIFY_FEATURE = $branchName
267: 
268: if ($Json) {
269:     $obj = [PSCustomObject]@{ 
270:         BRANCH_NAME = $branchName
271:         SPEC_FILE = $specFile
272:         FEATURE_NUM = $featureNum
273:         HAS_GIT = $hasGit
274:     }
275:     $obj | ConvertTo-Json -Compress
276: } else {
277:     Write-Output "BRANCH_NAME: $branchName"
278:     Write-Output "SPEC_FILE: $specFile"
279:     Write-Output "FEATURE_NUM: $featureNum"
280:     Write-Output "HAS_GIT: $hasGit"
281:     Write-Output "SPECIFY_FEATURE environment variable set to: $branchName"
282: }
````

## File: .specify/scripts/powershell/setup-plan.ps1
````powershell
 1: #!/usr/bin/env pwsh
 2: # Setup implementation plan for a feature
 3: 
 4: [CmdletBinding()]
 5: param(
 6:     [switch]$Json,
 7:     [switch]$Help
 8: )
 9: 
10: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
11: 
12: # Show help if requested
13: if ($Help) {
14:     Write-Output "Usage: ./setup-plan.ps1 [-Json] [-Help]"
15:     Write-Output "  -Json     Output results in JSON format"
16:     Write-Output "  -Help     Show this help message"
17:     exit 0
18: }
19: 
20: # Load common functions
21: . "$PSScriptRoot/common.ps1"
22: 
23: # Get all paths and variables from common functions
24: $paths = Get-FeaturePathsEnv
25: 
26: # Check if we're on a proper feature branch (only for git repos)
27: if (-not (Test-FeatureBranch -Branch $paths.CURRENT_BRANCH -HasGit $paths.HAS_GIT)) { 
28:     exit 1 
29: }
30: 
31: # Ensure the feature directory exists
32: New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $paths.FEATURE_DIR -Force | Out-Null
33: 
34: # Copy plan template if it exists, otherwise note it or create empty file
35: $template = Join-Path $paths.REPO_ROOT '.specify/templates/plan-template.md'
36: if (Test-Path $template) { 
37:     Copy-Item $template $paths.IMPL_PLAN -Force
38:     Write-Output "Copied plan template to $($paths.IMPL_PLAN)"
39: } else {
40:     Write-Warning "Plan template not found at $template"

43: }
44: 
45: # Output results
46: if ($Json) {
47:     $result = [PSCustomObject]@{ 
48:         FEATURE_SPEC = $paths.FEATURE_SPEC
49:         IMPL_PLAN = $paths.IMPL_PLAN
50:         SPECS_DIR = $paths.FEATURE_DIR
51:         BRANCH = $paths.CURRENT_BRANCH
52:         HAS_GIT = $paths.HAS_GIT
53:     }
54:     $result | ConvertTo-Json -Compress
55: } else {
56:     Write-Output "FEATURE_SPEC: $($paths.FEATURE_SPEC)"
57:     Write-Output "IMPL_PLAN: $($paths.IMPL_PLAN)"
58:     Write-Output "SPECS_DIR: $($paths.FEATURE_DIR)"
59:     Write-Output "BRANCH: $($paths.CURRENT_BRANCH)"
60:     Write-Output "HAS_GIT: $($paths.HAS_GIT)"
61: }
````

## File: .specify/scripts/powershell/update-agent-context.ps1
````powershell
  1: #!/usr/bin/env pwsh
  2: <#!
  3: .SYNOPSIS
  4: Update agent context files with information from plan.md (PowerShell version)
  5: 
  6: .DESCRIPTION
  7: Mirrors the behavior of scripts/bash/update-agent-context.sh:
  8:  1. Environment Validation
  9:  2. Plan Data Extraction
 10:  3. Agent File Management (create from template or update existing)
 11:  4. Content Generation (technology stack, recent changes, timestamp)
 12:  5. Multi-Agent Support (claude, gemini, copilot, cursor-agent, qwen, opencode, codex, windsurf, kilocode, auggie, roo, codebuddy, amp, shai, q, bob, qoder)
 13: 
 14: .PARAMETER AgentType
 15: Optional agent key to update a single agent. If omitted, updates all existing agent files (creating a default Claude file if none exist).
 16: 
 17: .EXAMPLE
 18: ./update-agent-context.ps1 -AgentType claude
 19: 
 20: .EXAMPLE
 21: ./update-agent-context.ps1   # Updates all existing agent files
 22: 
 23: .NOTES
 24: Relies on common helper functions in common.ps1
 25: #>
 26: param(
 27:     [Parameter(Position=0)]
 28:     [ValidateSet('claude','gemini','copilot','cursor-agent','qwen','opencode','codex','windsurf','kilocode','auggie','roo','codebuddy','amp','shai','q','bob','qoder')]
 29:     [string]$AgentType
 30: )
 31: 
 32: $ErrorActionPreference = 'Stop'
 33: 
 34: # Import common helpers
 35: $ScriptDir = Split-Path -Parent $MyInvocation.MyCommand.Path
 36: . (Join-Path $ScriptDir 'common.ps1')
 37: 
 38: # Acquire environment paths
 39: $envData = Get-FeaturePathsEnv
 40: $REPO_ROOT     = $envData.REPO_ROOT
 41: $CURRENT_BRANCH = $envData.CURRENT_BRANCH
 42: $HAS_GIT       = $envData.HAS_GIT
 43: $IMPL_PLAN     = $envData.IMPL_PLAN
 44: $NEW_PLAN = $IMPL_PLAN
 45: 
 46: # Agent file paths

123: function Extract-PlanField {
124:     param(
125:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
126:         [string]$FieldPattern,
127:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
128:         [string]$PlanFile
129:     )
130:     if (-not (Test-Path $PlanFile)) { return '' }
131:     # Lines like **Language/Version**: Python 3.12
132:     $regex = "^\*\*$([Regex]::Escape($FieldPattern))\*\*: (.+)$"
133:     Get-Content -LiteralPath $PlanFile -Encoding utf8 | ForEach-Object {
134:         if ($_ -match $regex) { 
135:             $val = $Matches[1].Trim()
136:             if ($val -notin @('NEEDS CLARIFICATION','N/A')) { return $val }
137:         }
138:     } | Select-Object -First 1
139: }

147:     Write-Info "Parsing plan data from $PlanFile"
148:     $script:NEW_LANG        = Extract-PlanField -FieldPattern 'Language/Version' -PlanFile $PlanFile
149:     $script:NEW_FRAMEWORK   = Extract-PlanField -FieldPattern 'Primary Dependencies' -PlanFile $PlanFile
150:     $script:NEW_DB          = Extract-PlanField -FieldPattern 'Storage' -PlanFile $PlanFile
151:     $script:NEW_PROJECT_TYPE = Extract-PlanField -FieldPattern 'Project Type' -PlanFile $PlanFile
152: 
153:     if ($NEW_LANG) { Write-Info "Found language: $NEW_LANG" } else { Write-WarningMsg 'No language information found in plan' }
154:     if ($NEW_FRAMEWORK) { Write-Info "Found framework: $NEW_FRAMEWORK" }
155:     if ($NEW_DB -and $NEW_DB -ne 'N/A') { Write-Info "Found database: $NEW_DB" }
156:     if ($NEW_PROJECT_TYPE) { Write-Info "Found project type: $NEW_PROJECT_TYPE" }
157:     return $true
158: }

160: function Format-TechnologyStack {

162:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$false)]

166:     )

169:     if ($Framework -and $Framework -notin @('NEEDS CLARIFICATION','N/A')) { $parts += $Framework }

203: function New-AgentFile {
204:     param(
205:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
206:         [string]$TargetFile,
207:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
208:         [string]$ProjectName,
209:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
210:         [datetime]$Date
211:     )
212:     if (-not (Test-Path $TEMPLATE_FILE)) { Write-Err "Template not found at $TEMPLATE_FILE"; return $false }
213:     $temp = New-TemporaryFile
214:     Copy-Item -LiteralPath $TEMPLATE_FILE -Destination $temp -Force
215: 
216:     $projectStructure = Get-ProjectStructure -ProjectType $NEW_PROJECT_TYPE
217:     $commands = Get-CommandsForLanguage -Lang $NEW_LANG
218:     $languageConventions = Get-LanguageConventions -Lang $NEW_LANG
219: 
220:     $escaped_lang = $NEW_LANG
221:     $escaped_framework = $NEW_FRAMEWORK
222:     $escaped_branch = $CURRENT_BRANCH
223: 
224:     $content = Get-Content -LiteralPath $temp -Raw -Encoding utf8
225:     $content = $content -replace '\[PROJECT NAME\]',$ProjectName
226:     $content = $content -replace '\[DATE\]',$Date.ToString('yyyy-MM-dd')
227:     
228:     # Build the technology stack string safely
229:     $techStackForTemplate = ""
230:     if ($escaped_lang -and $escaped_framework) {
231:         $techStackForTemplate = "- $escaped_lang + $escaped_framework ($escaped_branch)"
232:     } elseif ($escaped_lang) {
233:         $techStackForTemplate = "- $escaped_lang ($escaped_branch)"
234:     } elseif ($escaped_framework) {
235:         $techStackForTemplate = "- $escaped_framework ($escaped_branch)"
236:     }
237:     
238:     $content = $content -replace '\[EXTRACTED FROM ALL PLAN.MD FILES\]',$techStackForTemplate
239:     # For project structure we manually embed (keep newlines)
240:     $escapedStructure = [Regex]::Escape($projectStructure)
241:     $content = $content -replace '\[ACTUAL STRUCTURE FROM PLANS\]',$escapedStructure
242:     # Replace escaped newlines placeholder after all replacements
243:     $content = $content -replace '\[ONLY COMMANDS FOR ACTIVE TECHNOLOGIES\]',$commands
244:     $content = $content -replace '\[LANGUAGE-SPECIFIC, ONLY FOR LANGUAGES IN USE\]',$languageConventions
245:     
246:     # Build the recent changes string safely
247:     $recentChangesForTemplate = ""
248:     if ($escaped_lang -and $escaped_framework) {
249:         $recentChangesForTemplate = "- ${escaped_branch}: Added ${escaped_lang} + ${escaped_framework}"
250:     } elseif ($escaped_lang) {
251:         $recentChangesForTemplate = "- ${escaped_branch}: Added ${escaped_lang}"
252:     } elseif ($escaped_framework) {
253:         $recentChangesForTemplate = "- ${escaped_branch}: Added ${escaped_framework}"
254:     }
255:     
256:     $content = $content -replace '\[LAST 3 FEATURES AND WHAT THEY ADDED\]',$recentChangesForTemplate
257:     # Convert literal \n sequences introduced by Escape to real newlines
258:     $content = $content -replace '\\n',[Environment]::NewLine
259: 
260:     $parent = Split-Path -Parent $TargetFile
261:     if (-not (Test-Path $parent)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $parent | Out-Null }
262:     Set-Content -LiteralPath $TargetFile -Value $content -NoNewline -Encoding utf8
263:     Remove-Item $temp -Force
264:     return $true
265: }

267: function Update-ExistingAgentFile {
268:     param(
269:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
270:         [string]$TargetFile,
271:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
272:         [datetime]$Date
273:     )
274:     if (-not (Test-Path $TargetFile)) { return (New-AgentFile -TargetFile $TargetFile -ProjectName (Split-Path $REPO_ROOT -Leaf) -Date $Date) }
275: 
276:     $techStack = Format-TechnologyStack -Lang $NEW_LANG -Framework $NEW_FRAMEWORK
277:     $newTechEntries = @()
278:     if ($techStack) {
279:         $escapedTechStack = [Regex]::Escape($techStack)
280:         if (-not (Select-String -Pattern $escapedTechStack -Path $TargetFile -Quiet)) { 
281:             $newTechEntries += "- $techStack ($CURRENT_BRANCH)" 
282:         }
283:     }
284:     if ($NEW_DB -and $NEW_DB -notin @('N/A','NEEDS CLARIFICATION')) {
285:         $escapedDB = [Regex]::Escape($NEW_DB)
286:         if (-not (Select-String -Pattern $escapedDB -Path $TargetFile -Quiet)) { 
287:             $newTechEntries += "- $NEW_DB ($CURRENT_BRANCH)" 
288:         }
289:     }
290:     $newChangeEntry = ''
291:     if ($techStack) { $newChangeEntry = "- ${CURRENT_BRANCH}: Added ${techStack}" }
292:     elseif ($NEW_DB -and $NEW_DB -notin @('N/A','NEEDS CLARIFICATION')) { $newChangeEntry = "- ${CURRENT_BRANCH}: Added ${NEW_DB}" }
293: 
294:     $lines = Get-Content -LiteralPath $TargetFile -Encoding utf8
295:     $output = New-Object System.Collections.Generic.List[string]
296:     $inTech = $false; $inChanges = $false; $techAdded = $false; $changeAdded = $false; $existingChanges = 0
297: 
298:     for ($i=0; $i -lt $lines.Count; $i++) {
299:         $line = $lines[$i]
300:         if ($line -eq '## Active Technologies') {
301:             $output.Add($line)
302:             $inTech = $true
303:             continue
304:         }
305:         if ($inTech -and $line -match '^##\s') {
306:             if (-not $techAdded -and $newTechEntries.Count -gt 0) { $newTechEntries | ForEach-Object { $output.Add($_) }; $techAdded = $true }
307:             $output.Add($line); $inTech = $false; continue
308:         }
309:         if ($inTech -and [string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($line)) {
310:             if (-not $techAdded -and $newTechEntries.Count -gt 0) { $newTechEntries | ForEach-Object { $output.Add($_) }; $techAdded = $true }
311:             $output.Add($line); continue
312:         }
313:         if ($line -eq '## Recent Changes') {
314:             $output.Add($line)
315:             if ($newChangeEntry) { $output.Add($newChangeEntry); $changeAdded = $true }
316:             $inChanges = $true
317:             continue
318:         }
319:         if ($inChanges -and $line -match '^##\s') { $output.Add($line); $inChanges = $false; continue }
320:         if ($inChanges -and $line -match '^- ') {
321:             if ($existingChanges -lt 2) { $output.Add($line); $existingChanges++ }
322:             continue
323:         }
324:         if ($line -match '\*\*Last updated\*\*: .*\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}') {
325:             $output.Add(($line -replace '\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2}',$Date.ToString('yyyy-MM-dd')))
326:             continue
327:         }
328:         $output.Add($line)
329:     }
330: 
331:     # Post-loop check: if we're still in the Active Technologies section and haven't added new entries
332:     if ($inTech -and -not $techAdded -and $newTechEntries.Count -gt 0) {
333:         $newTechEntries | ForEach-Object { $output.Add($_) }
334:     }
335: 
336:     Set-Content -LiteralPath $TargetFile -Value ($output -join [Environment]::NewLine) -Encoding utf8
337:     return $true
338: }

340: function Update-AgentFile {
341:     param(
342:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
343:         [string]$TargetFile,
344:         [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
345:         [string]$AgentName
346:     )
347:     if (-not $TargetFile -or -not $AgentName) { Write-Err 'Update-AgentFile requires TargetFile and AgentName'; return $false }
348:     Write-Info "Updating $AgentName context file: $TargetFile"
349:     $projectName = Split-Path $REPO_ROOT -Leaf
350:     $date = Get-Date
351: 
352:     $dir = Split-Path -Parent $TargetFile
353:     if (-not (Test-Path $dir)) { New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path $dir | Out-Null }
354: 
355:     if (-not (Test-Path $TargetFile)) {
356:         if (New-AgentFile -TargetFile $TargetFile -ProjectName $projectName -Date $date) { Write-Success "Created new $AgentName context file" } else { Write-Err 'Failed to create new agent file'; return $false }
357:     } else {
358:         try {
359:             if (Update-ExistingAgentFile -TargetFile $TargetFile -Date $date) { Write-Success "Updated existing $AgentName context file" } else { Write-Err 'Failed to update agent file'; return $false }
360:         } catch {
361:             Write-Err "Cannot access or update existing file: $TargetFile. $_"
362:             return $false
363:         }
364:     }
365:     return $true
366: }

399:     if (Test-Path $GEMINI_FILE)   { if (-not (Update-AgentFile -TargetFile $GEMINI_FILE   -AgentName 'Gemini CLI')) { $ok = $false }; $found = $true }

402:     if (Test-Path $QWEN_FILE)     { if (-not (Update-AgentFile -TargetFile $QWEN_FILE     -AgentName 'Qwen Code')) { $ok = $false }; $found = $true }
403:     if (Test-Path $AGENTS_FILE)   { if (-not (Update-AgentFile -TargetFile $AGENTS_FILE   -AgentName 'Codex/opencode')) { $ok = $false }; $found = $true }

405:     if (Test-Path $KILOCODE_FILE) { if (-not (Update-AgentFile -TargetFile $KILOCODE_FILE -AgentName 'Kilo Code')) { $ok = $false }; $found = $true }

408:     if (Test-Path $CODEBUDDY_FILE) { if (-not (Update-AgentFile -TargetFile $CODEBUDDY_FILE -AgentName 'CodeBuddy CLI')) { $ok = $false }; $found = $true }

412:     if (Test-Path $BOB_FILE)      { if (-not (Update-AgentFile -TargetFile $BOB_FILE      -AgentName 'IBM Bob')) { $ok = $false }; $found = $true }

424:     if ($NEW_FRAMEWORK) { Write-Host "  - Added framework: $NEW_FRAMEWORK" }
425:     if ($NEW_DB -and $NEW_DB -ne 'N/A') { Write-Host "  - Added database: $NEW_DB" }

427:     Write-Info 'Usage: ./update-agent-context.ps1 [-AgentType claude|gemini|copilot|cursor-agent|qwen|opencode|codex|windsurf|kilocode|auggie|roo|codebuddy|amp|shai|q|bob|qoder]'

433:     if (-not (Parse-PlanData -PlanFile $NEW_PLAN)) { Write-Err 'Failed to parse plan data'; exit 1 }
434:     $success = $true

437:         if (-not (Update-SpecificAgent -Type $AgentType)) { $success = $false }

439:     else {

441:         if (-not (Update-AllExistingAgents)) { $success = $false }
````

````csharp
106:             var query = Helper_SqlQueryLoader.LoadAndPrepareQuery("02_ValidatePONumber.sql");
107:             await using var command = new SqlCommand(query, connection);
108:             command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@PoNumber", poNumber);
109: 
110:             var count = Convert.ToInt32(await command.ExecuteScalarAsync());
111:             bool isValid = count > 0;
112:             _logger?.LogInfo($"PO validation result for {poNumber}: {isValid}");
113:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Success(isValid);
114:         }
115:         catch (Exception ex)
116:         {
117:             _logger?.LogError($"Error validating PO {poNumber}: {ex.Message}", ex);
118:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<bool>(
119:                 $"Error validating PO {poNumber}: {ex.Message}",
120:                 ex);
121:         }
122:     }
123: }
````

## File: Module_Core/Helpers/Database/Helper_SqlQueryLoader.cs
````csharp
  1: using System;
  2: using System.IO;
  3: using System.Reflection;
  4: 
  5: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Helpers.Database
  6: {
  7:     /// <summary>
  8:     /// Helper class to load SQL queries from embedded resource files
  9:     /// </summary>
 10:     public static class Helper_SqlQueryLoader
 11:     {
 12:         /// <summary>
 13:         /// Loads a SQL query from an embedded resource file
 14:         /// </summary>
 15:         /// <param name="resourcePath">Path to the SQL file relative to Database/InforVisual (e.g., "01_GetPOWithParts.sql")</param>
 16:         /// <returns>The SQL query text</returns>
 17:         public static string LoadInforVisualQuery(string resourcePath)
 18:         {
 19:             try
 20:             {
 21:                 // Get the executing assembly
 22:                 var assembly = Assembly.GetExecutingAssembly();
 23:                 var resourceName = $"MTM_Receiving_Application.Database.InforVisualScripts.Queries.{resourcePath}";
 24: 
 25:                 using var stream = assembly.GetManifestResourceStream(resourceName);
 26:                 if (stream == null)
 27:                 {
 28:                     // Fallback: Try to load from file system during development
 29:                     var baseDir = AppDomain.CurrentDomain.BaseDirectory;
 30:                     var filePath = Path.Combine(baseDir, "Database", "InforVisualScripts", "Queries", resourcePath);
 31: 
 32:                     if (File.Exists(filePath))
 33:                     {
 34:                         return File.ReadAllText(filePath);
 35:                     }
 36: 
 37:                     // Try relative to solution root
 38:                     var solutionRoot = Directory.GetParent(baseDir)?.Parent?.Parent?.Parent?.FullName;
 39:                     if (solutionRoot != null)
 40:                     {
 41:                         filePath = Path.Combine(solutionRoot, "Database", "InforVisualScripts", "Queries", resourcePath);
 42:                         if (File.Exists(filePath))
 43:                         {
 44:                             return File.ReadAllText(filePath);
 45:                         }
 46:                     }
 47: 
 48:                     throw new FileNotFoundException($"SQL query file not found: {resourcePath}. Resource name attempted: {resourceName}");
 49:                 }
 50: 
 51:                 using var reader = new StreamReader(stream);
 52:                 return reader.ReadToEnd();
 53:             }
 54:             catch (Exception ex)
 55:             {
 56:                 throw new InvalidOperationException($"Failed to load SQL query from {resourcePath}: {ex.Message}", ex);
 57:             }
 58:         }
 59: 
 60:         /// <summary>
 61:         /// Cleans a SQL query by removing comments and normalizing whitespace
 62:         /// </summary>
 63:         /// <param name="sql">Raw SQL text</param>
 64:         /// <returns>Cleaned SQL query ready for execution</returns>
 65:         public static string CleanQuery(string sql)
 66:         {
 67:             if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(sql))
 68:             {
 69:                 return string.Empty;
 70:             }
 71: 
 72:             // Remove single-line comments (-- comments)
 73:             var lines = sql.Split(new[] { "\r\n", "\r", "\n" }, StringSplitOptions.None);
 74:             var cleanedLines = new System.Collections.Generic.List<string>();
 75: 
 76:             foreach (var line in lines)
 77:             {
 78:                 var trimmedLine = line.Trim();
 79: 
 80:                 // Skip comment-only lines
 81:                 if (trimmedLine.StartsWith("--"))
 82:                 {
 83:                     continue;
 84:                 }
 85: 
 86:                 // Remove inline comments
 87:                 var commentIndex = line.IndexOf("--");
 88:                 if (commentIndex >= 0)
 89:                 {
 90:                     var lineWithoutComment = line.Substring(0, commentIndex).TrimEnd();
 91:                     if (!string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(lineWithoutComment))
 92:                     {
 93:                         cleanedLines.Add(lineWithoutComment);
 94:                     }
 95:                 }
 96:                 else if (!string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(line))
 97:                 {
 98:                     cleanedLines.Add(line);
 99:                 }
100:             }
101: 
102:             return string.Join(Environment.NewLine, cleanedLines);
103:         }
104: 
105:         /// <summary>
106:         /// Extracts the actual query from a SQL file that includes DECLARE statements for testing
107:         /// </summary>
108:         /// <param name="sqlFileContent">Full SQL file content with DECLAREs</param>
109:         /// <returns>Just the SELECT/query portion without DECLARE statements</returns>
110:         public static string ExtractQueryFromFile(string sqlFileContent)
111:         {
112:             if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(sqlFileContent))
113:             {
114:                 return string.Empty;
115:             }
116: 
117:             // Find the start of the actual query (after DECLARE statements)
118:             var lines = sqlFileContent.Split(new[] { "\r\n", "\r", "\n" }, StringSplitOptions.None);
119:             var queryLines = new System.Collections.Generic.List<string>();
120:             bool foundQueryStart = false;
121: 
122:             foreach (var line in lines)
123:             {
124:                 var trimmedLine = line.Trim();
125: 
126:                 // Skip comments
127:                 if (trimmedLine.StartsWith("--"))
128:                 {
129:                     continue;
130:                 }
131: 
132:                 // Skip DECLARE statements
133:                 if (trimmedLine.StartsWith("DECLARE", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase))
134:                 {
135:                     continue;
136:                 }
137: 
138:                 // Look for SELECT, WITH, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE as query start
139:                 if (!foundQueryStart &&
140:                     (trimmedLine.StartsWith("SELECT", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) ||
141:                      trimmedLine.StartsWith("WITH", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) ||
142:                      trimmedLine.StartsWith("INSERT", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) ||
143:                      trimmedLine.StartsWith("UPDATE", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase) ||
144:                      trimmedLine.StartsWith("DELETE", StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase)))
145:                 {
146:                     foundQueryStart = true;
147:                 }
148: 
149:                 if (foundQueryStart && !string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(line))
150:                 {
151:                     queryLines.Add(line);
152:                 }
153:             }
154: 
155:             return string.Join(Environment.NewLine, queryLines);
156:         }
157: 
158:         /// <summary>
159:         /// Loads and prepares a SQL query for execution (removes test DECLAREs and comments)
160:         /// </summary>
161:         /// <param name="resourcePath">SQL file name</param>
162:         /// <returns>Clean, executable SQL query</returns>
163:         public static string LoadAndPrepareQuery(string resourcePath)
164:         {
165:             var rawSql = LoadInforVisualQuery(resourcePath);
166:             var extractedQuery = ExtractQueryFromFile(rawSql);
167:             return extractedQuery.Trim();
168:         }
169:     }
170: }
````

````csharp
 25:     /// <summary>

 29:     public static void CenterOnScreen(this Window window)
 30:     {
 31:         var appWindow = window.GetAppWindow();
 32:         var displayArea = DisplayArea.Primary;

 34: 
 35:         var x = (workArea.Width - appWindow.Size.Width) / 2;
````

## File: Module_Core/Services/Database/Service_ErrorHandler.cs
````csharp
  1: using System;
  2: using System.Threading.Tasks;
  3: using Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls;
  4: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services;
  5: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Models.Enums;
  6: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Models.Core;
  7: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Receiving.Models;
  8: 
  9: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services.Database;
 10: 
 11: /// <summary>
 12: /// Centralized error handling service
 13: /// Logs errors and displays user-friendly WinUI 3 dialogs
 14: /// </summary>
 15: public class Service_ErrorHandler : IService_ErrorHandler
 16: {
 17:     private readonly IService_LoggingUtility _loggingService;
 18:     private readonly IService_Window _windowService;
 19: 
 20:     public Service_ErrorHandler(IService_LoggingUtility loggingService, IService_Window windowService)
 21:     {
 22:         _loggingService = loggingService ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(loggingService));
 23:         _windowService = windowService ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(windowService));
 24:     }
 25: 
 26:     /// <summary>
 27:     /// Handles an error by logging it and optionally displaying a dialog
 28:     /// </summary>
 29:     /// <param name="errorMessage"></param>
 30:     /// <param name="severity"></param>
 31:     /// <param name="exception"></param>
 32:     /// <param name="showDialog"></param>
 33:     public async Task HandleErrorAsync(
 34:         string errorMessage,
 35:         Enum_ErrorSeverity severity,
 36:         Exception? exception = null,
 37:         bool showDialog = true)
 38:     {
 39:         // Log the error
 40:         await LogErrorAsync(errorMessage, severity, exception);
 41: 
 42:         // Show dialog if requested
 43:         if (showDialog)
 44:         {
 45:             string title = GetDialogTitle(severity);
 46:             await ShowErrorDialogAsync(title, errorMessage, severity);
 47:         }
 48:     }
 49: 
 50:     /// <summary>
 51:     /// Logs an error without displaying a dialog
 52:     /// </summary>
 53:     /// <param name="errorMessage"></param>
 54:     /// <param name="severity"></param>
 55:     /// <param name="exception"></param>
 56:     public Task LogErrorAsync(
 57:         string errorMessage,
 58:         Enum_ErrorSeverity severity,
 59:         Exception? exception = null)
 60:     {
 61:         return Task.Run(() =>
 62:         {
 63:             switch (severity)
 64:             {
 65:                 case Enum_ErrorSeverity.Info:
 66:                     _loggingService.LogInfo(errorMessage);
 67:                     break;
 68:                 case Enum_ErrorSeverity.Warning:
 69:                     _loggingService.LogWarning(errorMessage);
 70:                     break;
 71:                 case Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error:
 72:                     _loggingService.LogError(errorMessage, exception);
 73:                     break;
 74:                 case Enum_ErrorSeverity.Critical:
 75:                     _loggingService.LogCritical(errorMessage, exception);
 76:                     break;
 77:                 case Enum_ErrorSeverity.Fatal:
 78:                     _loggingService.LogFatal(errorMessage, exception);
 79:                     break;
 80:             }
 81:         });
 82:     }
 83: 
 84:     /// <summary>
 85:     /// Displays a user-friendly error dialog using WinUI 3 ContentDialog
 86:     /// </summary>
 87:     /// <param name="title"></param>
 88:     /// <param name="message"></param>
 89:     /// <param name="severity"></param>
 90:     public async Task ShowErrorDialogAsync(
 91:         string title,
 92:         string message,
 93:         Enum_ErrorSeverity severity)
 94:     {
 95:         try
 96:         {
 97:             // Get the main window's XamlRoot for dialog display
 98:             // Note: App.MainWindow is static but might not be accessible in all contexts (e.g. tests)
 99:             // We use a safe access pattern or dependency injection for window provider in a real app
100:             // For now, we assume App.MainWindow is available as it's a static property of the App class
101:             // However, since 'App' is in the root namespace, we might need to qualify it or ensure it's accessible.
102:             // If 'App' is not found, it might be because we are in a library or test context where App is not defined or accessible.
103:             // In WinUI 3, (Application.Current as App)?.MainWindow is a common pattern.
104: 
105:             // Using dynamic to avoid direct dependency on App class which might not be visible here
106:             // or simply checking Application.Current
107: 
108:             // Use IWindowService to get the XamlRoot
109:             var xamlRoot = _windowService.GetXamlRoot();
110: 
111:             if (xamlRoot == null)
112:             {
113:                 // Fallback: Just log if we can't show dialog
114:                 _loggingService.LogWarning("Cannot show dialog - XamlRoot is null");
115:                 return;
116:             }
117: 
118:             var dialog = new ContentDialog
119:             {
120:                 Title = title,
121:                 Content = message,
122:                 CloseButtonText = "OK",
123:                 XamlRoot = xamlRoot
124:             };
125: 
126:             // Set dialog style based on severity (could be enhanced with custom styles)
127:             // For now, just show the dialog
128:             await dialog.ShowAsync();
129:         }
130:         catch (Exception ex)
131:         {
132:             // If dialog fails, at least log it
133:             _loggingService.LogError($"Failed to show error dialog: {ex.Message}", ex);
134:         }
135:     }
136: 
137:     /// <summary>
138:     /// Handles a Model_Dao_Result error by logging and optionally displaying
139:     /// </summary>
140:     /// <param name="result"></param>
141:     /// <param name="operationName"></param>
142:     /// <param name="showDialog"></param>
143:     public async Task HandleDaoErrorAsync(
144:         Model_Dao_Result result,
145:         string operationName,
146:         bool showDialog = true)
147:     {
148:         if (result.Success)
149:         {
150:             // Not an error
151:             return;
152:         }
153: 
154:         string errorMessage = $"Database operation '{operationName}' failed: {result.ErrorMessage}";
155: 
156:         await HandleErrorAsync(
157:             errorMessage,
158:             result.Severity,
159:             exception: null,
160:             showDialog: showDialog
161:         );
162:     }
163: 
164:     public Task ShowUserErrorAsync(string message, string title, string method)
165:     {
166:         return ShowErrorDialogAsync(title, message, Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error);
167:     }
168: 
169:     public void HandleException(Exception ex, Enum_ErrorSeverity severity, string method, string className)
170:     {
171:         _ = HandleErrorAsync($"Exception in {className}.{method}: {ex.Message}", severity, ex, true);
172:     }
173: 
174:     /// <summary>
175:     /// Gets appropriate dialog title based on severity
176:     /// </summary>
177:     /// <param name="severity"></param>
178:     private static string GetDialogTitle(Enum_ErrorSeverity severity)
179:     {
180:         return severity switch
181:         {
182:             Enum_ErrorSeverity.Info => "Information",
183:             Enum_ErrorSeverity.Warning => "Warning",
184:             Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error => "Error",
185:             Enum_ErrorSeverity.Critical => "Critical Error",
186:             Enum_ErrorSeverity.Fatal => "Fatal Error",
187:             _ => "Error"
188:         };
189:     }
190: }
````

## File: Module_Core/Services/Database/Service_InforVisualConnect.cs
````csharp
  1: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services;
  2: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Data.InforVisual;
  3: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Models.Core;
  4: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Receiving.Models;
  5: using System;
  6: using System.Collections.Generic;
  7: using System.Linq;
  8: using System.Threading.Tasks;
  9: 
 10: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services.Database;
 11: 
 12: /// <summary>
 13: /// Service for connecting to and querying Infor Visual database (SQL Server)
 14: ///  STRICTLY READ ONLY - NO WRITES ALLOWED TO INFOR VISUAL 
 15: /// Server: VISUAL, Database: MTMFG, Warehouse: 002
 16: /// </summary>
 17: public class Service_InforVisualConnect : IService_InforVisual
 18: {
 19:     private readonly Dao_InforVisualConnection _dao;
 20:     private readonly IService_LoggingUtility? _logger;
 21:     private readonly bool _useMockData;
 22: 
 23:     public Service_InforVisualConnect(
 24:         Dao_InforVisualConnection dao,
 25:         bool useMockData = false,
 26:         IService_LoggingUtility? logger = null)
 27:     {
 28:         _dao = dao ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(dao));
 29:         _useMockData = useMockData;
 30:         _logger = logger;
 31:     }
 32: 
 33:     #region Connection Testing
 34: 
 35:     public async Task<bool> TestConnectionAsync()
 36:     {
 37:         if (_useMockData)
 38:         {
 39:             _logger?.LogInfo("[MOCK DATA MODE] Simulating successful Infor Visual connection test");
 40:             return true;
 41:         }
 42: 
 43:         try
 44:         {
 45:             _logger?.LogInfo("Testing Infor Visual connection...");
 46:             var result = await _dao.TestConnectionAsync();
 47: 
 48:             if (result.IsSuccess)
 49:             {
 50:                 _logger?.LogInfo($"Infor Visual connection test: {(result.Data ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED")}");
 51:                 return result.Data;
 52:             }
 53: 
 54:             _logger?.LogError($"Connection test failed: {result.ErrorMessage}");
 55:             return false;
 56:         }
 57:         catch (Exception ex)
 58:         {
 59:             _logger?.LogError($"Connection test exception: {ex.Message}", ex);
 60:             return false;
 61:         }
 62:     }
 63: 
 64:     #endregion
 65: 
 66:     #region Purchase Order Operations
 67: 
 68:     public async Task<Model_Dao_Result<Model_InforVisualPO?>> GetPOWithPartsAsync(string poNumber)
 69:     {
 70:         if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(poNumber))
 71:         {
 72:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<Model_InforVisualPO?>(
 73:                 "PO number cannot be null or empty");
 74:         }
 75: 
 76:         // Use the PO number as provided - Infor Visual IDs include the prefix (e.g. "PO-123456")
 77:         string cleanPoNumber = poNumber;
 78: 
 79:         if (_useMockData)
 80:         {
 81:             _logger?.LogInfo($"[MOCK DATA MODE] Returning mock data for PO: {cleanPoNumber}");
 82:             return CreateMockPO(cleanPoNumber);
 83:         }
 84: 
 85:         try
 86:         {
 87:             _logger?.LogInfo($"Querying Infor Visual for PO: {cleanPoNumber}");
 88: 
 89:             var result = await _dao.GetPOWithPartsAsync(cleanPoNumber);
 90: 
 91:             if (!result.IsSuccess)
 92:             {
 93:                 _logger?.LogError($"Failed to retrieve PO {cleanPoNumber}: {result.ErrorMessage}");
 94:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<Model_InforVisualPO?>(result.ErrorMessage);
 95:             }
 96: 
 97:             if (result.Data == null || result.Data.Count == 0)

100:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Success<Model_InforVisualPO?>(null);

107:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Success<Model_InforVisualPO?>(po);

189:     {
190:         if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(poNumber))
191:         {
192:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>("PO number cannot be null or empty");
193:         }
194: 
195:         if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(partID))
196:         {
197:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>("Part ID cannot be null or empty");
198:         }
199: 
200:         if (_useMockData)
201:         {
202:             _logger?.LogInfo($"[MOCK DATA MODE] Returning mock remaining quantity: 100");
203:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Success<int>(100);
204:         }
205: 
206:         try
207:         {
208:             _logger?.LogInfo($"Calculating remaining quantity for PO: {poNumber}, Part: {partID}");
209: 
210:             var result = await _dao.GetPOWithPartsAsync(poNumber);
211: 
212:             if (!result.IsSuccess || result.Data == null || result.Data.Count == 0)
213:             {
214:                 _logger?.LogWarning($"Failed to retrieve PO {poNumber}");
215:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>("PO not found");
216:             }
217: 
218:             var matchingLine = result.Data.FirstOrDefault(line =>
219:                 line.PartNumber.Equals(partID, StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase));

222:             {
223:                 _logger?.LogWarning($"Part {partID} not found on PO {poNumber}");
224:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>("Part not found on PO");

231:         }

235:             return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>($"Unexpected error: {ex.Message}", ex);
236:         }
````

````csharp
  1: using System;

  9: /// <summary>
 10: /// Implements file-based logging with daily rotation
 11: /// Logs are written to %APPDATA%\MTM_Receiving_Application\Logs\
 12: /// </summary>
 13: public class Service_LoggingUtility : IService_LoggingUtility
 14: {
 15:     private readonly string _logDirectory;
 16:     private readonly object _lockObject = new object();
 17:     private readonly System.Collections.Concurrent.BlockingCollection<string> _logQueue = new();
 18: 
 19:     public Service_LoggingUtility()
 20:     {
 21:         _logDirectory = Path.Combine(
 22:             Environment.GetFolderPath(Environment.SpecialFolder.ApplicationData),
 23:             "MTM_Receiving_Application",
 24:             "Logs"
 25:         );
 26: 
 27:         EnsureLogDirectoryExists();
 28: 
 29:         // Start background logging thread
 30:         System.Threading.Tasks.Task.Factory.StartNew(ProcessLogQueue,
 31:             System.Threading.CancellationToken.None,
 32:             System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCreationOptions.LongRunning,
 33:             System.Threading.Tasks.TaskScheduler.Default);
 34:     }
 35: 
 36:     private void ProcessLogQueue()
 37:     {
 38:         foreach (var logEntry in _logQueue.GetConsumingEnumerable())
 39:         {
 40:             try
 41:             {
 42:                 string logFilePath = GetCurrentLogFilePath();
 43:                 lock (_lockObject)
 44:                 {
 45:                     File.AppendAllText(logFilePath, logEntry, Encoding.UTF8);
 46:                 }
 47:             }
 48:             catch (Exception ex)
 49:             {
 50:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Background logging failed: {ex.Message}");
 51:             }
 52:         }
 53:     }
 54: 
 55:     /// <summary>
 56:     /// Logs an informational message
 57:     /// </summary>
 58:     /// <param name="message"></param>
 59:     /// <param name="context"></param>
 60:     public void LogInfo(string message, string? context = null)
 61:     {
 62:         WriteLog("INFO", message, null, context);
 63:     }
 64: 
 65:     /// <summary>
 66:     /// Logs a warning message
 67:     /// </summary>
 68:     /// <param name="message"></param>
 69:     /// <param name="context"></param>
 70:     public void LogWarning(string message, string? context = null)
 71:     {
 72:         WriteLog("WARNING", message, null, context);
 73:     }
 74: 
 75:     /// <summary>
 76:     /// Logs an error message with optional exception
 77:     /// </summary>
 78:     /// <param name="message"></param>
 79:     /// <param name="exception"></param>

 82:     {
 83:         WriteLog("ERROR", message, exception, context);

 86:     /// <summary>

 93:     {

101:     /// <param name="exception"></param>

120:     /// <summary>
121:     /// Gets the path to today's log file
122:     /// </summary>
123:     public string GetCurrentLogFilePath()
124:     {
125:         string fileName = $"app_{DateTime.Now:yyyy-MM-dd}.log";
126:         return Path.Combine(_logDirectory, fileName);
127:     }
128: 
129:     /// <summary>
130:     /// Ensures the log directory exists and is writable
131:     /// </summary>
132:     public bool EnsureLogDirectoryExists()
133:     {
134:         try
135:         {
136:             if (!Directory.Exists(_logDirectory))
137:             {
138:                 Directory.CreateDirectory(_logDirectory);
139:             }
140:             return true;
141:         }
142:         catch (Exception ex)
143:         {
144:             // Can't log this error since logging is broken
145:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Failed to create log directory: {ex.Message}");
146:             return false;
147:         }
148:     }
149: 
150:     /// <summary>
151:     /// Archives old log files (older than specified days)
152:     /// </summary>
153:     /// <param name="daysToKeep"></param>
154:     public int ArchiveOldLogs(int daysToKeep = 30)
155:     {
156:         int archivedCount = 0;
157: 
158:         try
159:         {
160:             if (!Directory.Exists(_logDirectory))
161:             {
162:                 return 0;
163:             }
164: 
165:             var cutoffDate = DateTime.Now.AddDays(-daysToKeep);
166:             var archiveDirectory = Path.Combine(_logDirectory, "archive");
167: 
168:             foreach (var file in Directory.GetFiles(_logDirectory, "app_*.log"))
169:             {
170:                 var fileInfo = new FileInfo(file);
171: 
172:                 if (fileInfo.LastWriteTime < cutoffDate)
173:                 {
174:                     // Create archive directory if it doesn't exist
175:                     if (!Directory.Exists(archiveDirectory))
176:                     {
177:                         Directory.CreateDirectory(archiveDirectory);
178:                     }
179: 
180:                     // Move file to archive
181:                     string archivePath = Path.Combine(archiveDirectory, fileInfo.Name);
182: 
183:                     // If file already exists in archive, delete it first
184:                     if (File.Exists(archivePath))
185:                     {
186:                         File.Delete(archivePath);
187:                     }
188: 
189:                     File.Move(file, archivePath);
190:                     archivedCount++;
191:                 }
192:             }
193:         }
194:         catch (Exception ex)
195:         {
196:             WriteLog("ERROR", $"Failed to archive old logs: {ex.Message}", ex, "LoggingUtility.ArchiveOldLogs");
197:         }
198: 
199:         return archivedCount;
200:     }
201: 
202:     /// <summary>
203:     /// Core logging method that writes to file
204:     /// </summary>
205:     /// <param name="severity"></param>
206:     /// <param name="message"></param>
207:     /// <param name="exception"></param>
208:     /// <param name="context"></param>
209:     private void WriteLog(string severity, string message, Exception? exception, string? context)
210:     {
211:         try
212:         {
213:             string logFilePath = GetCurrentLogFilePath();
214:             var logEntry = new StringBuilder();
215: 
216:             // Timestamp and severity
217:             logEntry.AppendLine($"[{DateTime.Now:yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.fff}] [{severity}] {(context != null ? $"[{context}]" : "")}");
218:             logEntry.AppendLine($"Message: {message}");
219: 
220:             // Add context information if provided
221:             if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(context))
222:             {
223:                 logEntry.AppendLine($"Context: User={Environment.UserName}, Machine={Environment.MachineName}");
224:             }
225: 
226:             // Add exception details if provided
227:             if (exception != null)
228:             {
229:                 logEntry.AppendLine($"Exception: {exception.GetType().FullName}: {exception.Message}");
230:                 logEntry.AppendLine($"Stack Trace:");
231:                 logEntry.AppendLine(exception.StackTrace);
232: 
233:                 // Log inner exceptions
234:                 var innerException = exception.InnerException;
235:                 while (innerException != null)
236:                 {
237:                     logEntry.AppendLine($"Inner Exception: {innerException.GetType().FullName}: {innerException.Message}");
238:                     logEntry.AppendLine(innerException.StackTrace);
239:                     innerException = innerException.InnerException;
240:                 }
241:             }
242: 
243:             logEntry.AppendLine(); // Blank line between entries
244: 
245:             // Queue for background writing
246:             _logQueue.Add(logEntry.ToString());
247: 
248:             // Also write to Debug output for development
249:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.Write(logEntry.ToString());
250:         }
251:         catch (Exception ex)
252:         {
253:             // Last resort - write to debug output if file logging fails
254:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"LOGGING FAILED: {ex.Message}");
255:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Original message: {message}");
256:         }
257:     }
258: 
259:     public Task LogWarningAsync(string message, string? context = null)
260:     {
261:         LogWarning(message, context);
262:         return Task.CompletedTask;
263:     }
264: }
````

````csharp
 54:             var tcs = new TaskCompletionSource<bool>();

152:     public List<Model_HelpContent> SearchHelp(string searchTerm)

165:             .ToList();
166:     }
167: 
168:     public async Task<bool> IsDismissedAsync(string helpKey)
169:     {
170:         await Task.CompletedTask;
171:         return _dismissedTips.Contains(helpKey);
172:     }
173: 
174:     public async Task SetDismissedAsync(string helpKey, bool isDismissed)
175:     {
176:         await Task.CompletedTask;
177:         if (isDismissed)
178:         {
179:             _dismissedTips.Add(helpKey);
180:         }
181:         else
182:         {
183:             _dismissedTips.Remove(helpKey);
184:         }
185:     }
````

## File: Module_Core/Services/Navigation/Service_Navigation.cs
````csharp
 1: using Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls;
 2: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services;
 3: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services.Navigation;
 4: using System;
 5: 
 6: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services.Navigation;
 7: 
 8: /// <summary>
 9: /// Service for handling page navigation
10: /// </summary>
11: public class Service_Navigation : IService_Navigation
12: {
13:     private readonly IService_LoggingUtility _logger;
14: 
15:     public Service_Navigation(IService_LoggingUtility logger)
16:     {
17:         _logger = logger;
18:     }
19: 
20:     public bool NavigateTo(Frame frame, Type pageType, object? parameter = null)
21:     {
22:         if (frame == null)
23:         {
24:             _logger.LogError("Navigation frame is null", null, "Service_Navigation");
25:             return false;
26:         }
27: 
28:         if (pageType == null)
29:         {
30:             _logger.LogError("Page type is null", null, "Service_Navigation");
31:             return false;
32:         }
33: 
34:         try
35:         {
36:             var result = frame.Navigate(pageType, parameter);
37:             if (result)
38:             {
39:                 _logger.LogInfo($"Navigated to {pageType.Name}", "Service_Navigation");
40:             }
41:             else
42:             {
43:                 _logger.LogWarning($"Failed to navigate to {pageType.Name}", "Service_Navigation");
44:             }
45:             return result;
46:         }
47:         catch (Exception ex)
48:         {
49:             _logger.LogError($"Navigation error: {ex.Message}", ex, "Service_Navigation");
50:             return false;
51:         }
52:     }
53: 
54:     public bool NavigateTo(Frame frame, string pageTypeName, object? parameter = null)
55:     {
56:         try
57:         {
58:             var pageType = Type.GetType(pageTypeName);
59:             if (pageType == null)
60:             {
61:                 _logger.LogError($"Could not find type: {pageTypeName}", null, "Service_Navigation");
62:                 return false;
63:             }
64:             return NavigateTo(frame, pageType, parameter);
65:         }
66:         catch (Exception ex)
67:         {
68:             _logger.LogError($"Navigation error: {ex.Message}", ex, "Service_Navigation");
69:             return false;
70:         }
71:     }
72: 
73:     public void ClearNavigation(Frame frame)
74:     {
75:         if (frame?.Content != null)
76:         {
77:             frame.Content = null;
78:             _logger.LogInfo("Navigation cleared", "Service_Navigation");
79:         }
80:     }
81: 
82:     public bool CanGoBack(Frame frame)
83:     {
84:         return frame?.CanGoBack ?? false;
85:     }
86: 
87:     public void GoBack(Frame frame)
88:     {
89:         if (frame?.CanGoBack == true)
90:         {
91:             frame.GoBack();
92:             _logger.LogInfo("Navigated back", "Service_Navigation");
93:         }
94:     }
95: }
````

````csharp

 9:     /// </summary>
````

````csharp
11:     {
12:         private readonly DispatcherQueueTimer _timer;
13: 
14:         public Service_DispatcherTimerWrapper(DispatcherQueueTimer timer)
15:         {
16:             _timer = timer ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(timer));
17:             _timer.Tick += (_, e) => Tick?.Invoke(this, e);
18:         }
19: 
20:         public TimeSpan Interval
21:         {
22:             get => _timer.Interval;
23:             set => _timer.Interval = value;
24:         }
25: 
26:         public bool IsRepeating
27:         {
28:             get => _timer.IsRepeating;
29:             set => _timer.IsRepeating = value;
30:         }
31: 
32:         public bool IsRunning => _timer.IsRunning;
33: 
34:         public event EventHandler<object>? Tick;
35: 
36:         public void Start() => _timer.Start();
37: 
38:         public void Stop() => _timer.Stop();
39:     }
````

## File: Module_Core/Services/Service_Focus.cs
````csharp
  1: using Microsoft.UI.Xaml;
  2: using Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Controls;
  3: using Microsoft.UI.Xaml.Media;
  4: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services;
  5: using System;
  6: 
  7: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services
  8: {
  9:     public class Service_Focus : IService_Focus
 10:     {
 11:         public void SetFocus(Control control)
 12:         {
 13:             if (control == null)
 14:             {
 15:                 return;
 16:             }
 17: 
 18:             // Ensure we are on the UI thread or use DispatcherQueue
 19:             if (control.DispatcherQueue != null)
 20:             {
 21:                 control.DispatcherQueue.TryEnqueue(() =>
 22:                 {
 23:                     control.Focus(FocusState.Programmatic);
 24:                 });
 25:             }
 26:             else
 27:             {
 28:                 control.Focus(FocusState.Programmatic);
 29:             }
 30:         }
 31: 
 32:         public void SetFocusFirstInput(DependencyObject container)
 33:         {
 34:             if (container == null)
 35:             {
 36:                 return;
 37:             }
 38: 
 39:             if (container is FrameworkElement fe && fe.DispatcherQueue != null)
 40:             {
 41:                 fe.DispatcherQueue.TryEnqueue(() =>
 42:                 {
 43:                     var control = FindFirstFocusableChild(container);
 44:                     control?.Focus(FocusState.Programmatic);
 45:                 });
 46:             }
 47:         }
 48: 
 49:         public void AttachFocusOnVisibility(FrameworkElement view, Control? targetControl = null)
 50:         {
 51:             if (view == null)
 52:             {
 53:                 return;
 54:             }
 55: 
 56:             // Initial check if already visible and loaded
 57:             if (view.IsLoaded && view.Visibility == Visibility.Visible)
 58:             {
 59:                 if (targetControl != null)
 60:                 {
 61:                     SetFocus(targetControl);
 62:                 }
 63:                 else
 64:                 {
 65:                     SetFocusFirstInput(view);
 66:                 }
 67:             }
 68: 
 69:             // Hook into Loaded to handle initial focus
 70:             view.Loaded += (_, _) =>
 71:             {
 72:                 if (view.Visibility == Visibility.Visible)
 73:                 {
 74:                     if (targetControl != null)
 75:                     {
 76:                         SetFocus(targetControl);
 77:                     }
 78:                     else
 79:                     {
 80:                         SetFocusFirstInput(view);
 81:                     }
 82:                 }
 83:             };
 84: 
 85:             // Hook into Visibility changes
 86:             view.RegisterPropertyChangedCallback(UIElement.VisibilityProperty, (_, _) =>
 87:             {
 88:                 if (view.Visibility == Visibility.Visible)
 89:                 {
 90:                     if (targetControl != null)
 91:                     {
 92:                         SetFocus(targetControl);
 93:                     }
 94:                     else
 95:                     {
 96:                         SetFocusFirstInput(view);
 97:                     }
 98:                 }
 99:             });
100:         }
101: 
102:         private Control? FindFirstFocusableChild(DependencyObject parent)
103:         {
104:             if (parent == null)
105:             {
106:                 return null;
107:             }
108: 
109:             int childrenCount = VisualTreeHelper.GetChildrenCount(parent);
110:             for (int i = 0; i < childrenCount; i++)
111:             {
112:                 var child = VisualTreeHelper.GetChild(parent, i);
113: 
114:                 if (child is Control control && IsFocusable(control))
115:                 {
116:                     return control;
117:                 }
118: 
119:                 var result = FindFirstFocusableChild(child);
120:                 if (result != null)
121:                 {
122:                     return result;
123:                 }
124:             }
125:             return null;
126:         }
127: 
128:         private bool IsFocusable(Control control)
129:         {
130:             if (!control.IsEnabled || control.Visibility != Visibility.Visible)
131:             {
132:                 return false;
133:             }
134: 
135:             // Check for specific input types we want to prioritize
136:             if (control is TextBox ||
137:                 control is NumberBox ||
138:                 control is ComboBox ||
139:                 control is PasswordBox ||
140:                 control is AutoSuggestBox)
141:             {
142:                 return true;
143:             }
144: 
145:             // Buttons and other controls are also focusable, but maybe we prefer inputs?
146:             // For now, let's include them but maybe inputs should be prioritized if we were doing a deeper search.
147:             // But since we are doing a depth-first search (or breadth-first?), the order matters.
148:             // The current implementation is depth-first.
149: 
150:             if (control is Button ||
151:                 control is CheckBox ||
152:                 control is RadioButton ||
153:                 control is ToggleSwitch ||
154:                 control is ListView ||
155:                 control is GridView)
156:             {
157:                 return true;
158:             }
159: 
160:             return false;
161:         }
162:     }
163: }
````

## File: Module_Core/Services/Service_Pagination.cs
````csharp
  1: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services;
  2: using System;
  3: using System.Collections.Generic;
  4: using System.Linq;
  5: 
  6: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services
  7: {
  8:     public class Service_Pagination : IService_Pagination
  9:     {
 10:         private IEnumerable<object>? _source;
 11: 
 12:         /// <summary>
 13:         /// Default page size
 14:         /// </summary>
 15:         private int _pageSize = 20;
 16: 
 17:         public int CurrentPage { get; private set; } = 1;
 18: 
 19:         public int TotalPages
 20:         {
 21:             get
 22:             {
 23:                 if (_source?.Any() != true)
 24:                 {
 25:                     return 1;
 26:                 }
 27: 
 28:                 return (int)Math.Ceiling((double)TotalItems / PageSize);
 29:             }
 30:         }
 31: 
 32:         public int PageSize
 33:         {
 34:             get => _pageSize;
 35:             set
 36:             {
 37:                 if (_pageSize != value)
 38:                 {
 39:                     _pageSize = value;
 40:                     CurrentPage = 1; // Reset to first page on size change
 41:                     OnPageChanged();
 42:                 }
 43:             }
 44:         }
 45: 
 46:         public int TotalItems => _source?.Count() ?? 0;
 47: 
 48:         public bool HasNextPage => CurrentPage < TotalPages;
 49: 
 50:         public bool HasPreviousPage => CurrentPage > 1;
 51: 
 52:         public event EventHandler? PageChanged;
 53: 
 54:         public void SetSource<T>(IEnumerable<T> source)
 55:         {
 56:             _source = source?.Cast<object>() ?? Enumerable.Empty<object>();
 57:             CurrentPage = 1;
 58:             OnPageChanged();
 59:         }
 60: 
 61:         public IEnumerable<T> GetCurrentPageItems<T>()
 62:         {
 63:             if (_source == null)
 64:             {
 65:                 return Enumerable.Empty<T>();
 66:             }
 67: 
 68:             return _source
 69:                 .Skip((CurrentPage - 1) * PageSize)
 70:                 .Take(PageSize)
 71:                 .Cast<T>();
 72:         }
 73: 
 74:         public bool NextPage()
 75:         {
 76:             if (HasNextPage)
 77:             {
 78:                 CurrentPage++;
 79:                 OnPageChanged();
 80:                 return true;
 81:             }
 82:             return false;
 83:         }
 84: 
 85:         public bool PreviousPage()
 86:         {
 87:             if (HasPreviousPage)
 88:             {
 89:                 CurrentPage--;
 90:                 OnPageChanged();
 91:                 return true;
 92:             }
 93:             return false;
 94:         }
 95: 
 96:         public bool FirstPage()
 97:         {
 98:             if (CurrentPage != 1)
 99:             {
100:                 CurrentPage = 1;
101:                 OnPageChanged();
102:                 return true;
103:             }
104:             return false;
105:         }
106: 
107:         public bool LastPage()
108:         {
109:             if (CurrentPage != TotalPages)
110:             {
111:                 CurrentPage = TotalPages;
112:                 OnPageChanged();
113:                 return true;
114:             }
115:             return false;
116:         }
117: 
118:         public bool GoToPage(int pageNumber)
119:         {
120:             if (pageNumber < 1)
121:             {
122:                 pageNumber = 1;
123:             }
124: 
125:             if (pageNumber > TotalPages)
126:             {
127:                 pageNumber = TotalPages;
128:             }
129: 
130:             if (CurrentPage != pageNumber)
131:             {
132:                 CurrentPage = pageNumber;
133:                 OnPageChanged();
134:                 return true;
135:             }
136:             return false;
137:         }
138: 
139:         private void OnPageChanged()
140:         {
141:             PageChanged?.Invoke(this, EventArgs.Empty);
142:         }
143:     }
144: }
````

````csharp

10:     {
11:         private readonly List<WeakReference<object>> _viewModels = new();
12: 
13:         public void Register(object viewModel)
14:         {
15:             _viewModels.Add(new WeakReference<object>(viewModel));
16:             Cleanup();
17:         }
18: 
19:         public IEnumerable<T> GetViewModels<T>()
20:         {
21:             Cleanup();
22:             return _viewModels
23:                 .Select(r => r.TryGetTarget(out var target) ? target : null)
24:                 .Where(t => t != null && t is T)
25:                 .Cast<T>();
26:         }
27: 
28:         public void ClearAllInputs()
29:         {
30:             Cleanup();
31:             foreach (var vmRef in _viewModels)
32:             {
33:                 if (vmRef.TryGetTarget(out var vm))
34:                 {
35:                     if (vm is IResettableViewModel resettable)
36:                     {
37:                         resettable.ResetToDefaults();
38:                     }
39:                 }
40:             }
41:         }
42: 
43:         private void Cleanup()
44:         {
45:             _viewModels.RemoveAll(r => !r.TryGetTarget(out _));
46:         }
47:     }
48: }
````

## File: _bmad/_memory/docent-sidecar/README.md
````markdown
 1: # Docent Sidecar - Persistent Memory
 2: 
 3: This folder stores persistent memory for the **Docent** Expert agent - Module Documentation Specialist.
 4: 
 5: ## Purpose
 6: 
 7: Docent maintains living documentation for WinUI 3 modules, tracking analyzed modules, discovered patterns, and validation history. The sidecar provides persistent storage for:
 8: 
 9: - **Module analysis history** - Which modules have been documented, when, and their current state
10: - **Pattern library** - Common architectural patterns discovered across modules
11: - **MTM conventions** - Project-specific MVVM patterns, naming conventions, and best practices
12: - **Validation tracking** - Last validation dates, detected drift, update history
13: 
14: ## Files
15: 
16: ### Core Memory Files
17: 
18: - **memories.md** - Module tracking registry, validation history, discovered patterns
19: - **instructions.md** - MTM architectural conventions, MVVM patterns, analysis protocols
20: 
21: ### Workflows (Complex Multi-Step Processes)
22: 
23: - **workflows/full-module-analysis.md** - Complete 7-section documentation generation
24: - **workflows/quick-analysis.md** - Fast module overview workflow
25: - **workflows/update-view-documentation.md** - Incremental View/ViewModel refresh
26: - **workflows/database-schema-analysis.md** - Database layer deep-dive
27: - **workflows/validate-documentation.md** - Documentation drift detection and correction
28: - **workflows/generate-diagram.md** - Mermaid diagram generation
29: 
30: ### Knowledge Base
31: 
32: - **knowledge/mvvm-patterns.md** - MVVM architecture patterns reference
33: - **knowledge/mermaid-diagram-templates.md** - Diagram generation templates
34: - **knowledge/mtm-architecture-reference.md** - MTM Receiving Application conventions
35: 
36: ## Access Pattern
37: 
38: Docent accesses these files via critical_actions on activation:
39: 
40: ```yaml
41: - Load COMPLETE file {project-root}/_bmad/_memory/docent-sidecar/memories.md
42: - Load COMPLETE file {project-root}/_bmad/_memory/docent-sidecar/instructions.md
43: ```
44: 
45: Commands reference workflow files:
46: 
47: ```yaml
48: exec: '{project-root}/_bmad/_memory/docent-sidecar/workflows/full-module-analysis.md'
49: ```
50: 
51: ## File Access Restrictions
52: 
53: Per critical_actions, Docent:
54: 
55: -  **CAN** read/write files in `_bmad/_memory/docent-sidecar/`
56: -  **CANNOT** access files outside this directory (safety constraint)
57: 
58: ## Memory Structure Philosophy
59: 
60: - **memories.md** = Dynamic tracking data (changes frequently)
61: - **instructions.md** = Stable reference data (changes rarely)
62: - **workflows/** = Executable processes (complex multi-step operations)
63: - **knowledge/** = Static reference material (architectural patterns)
64: 
65: ---
66: 
67: **Created:** 2026-01-08  
68: **Agent:** Docent (Expert Agent)  
69: **Version:** 1.0.0
````

````
 11:   created: "2026-01-08"
 12: 
 13: module:
 14:   path: "bmb:agents:docent"
 15:   standalone: true
 16: 
 17: metadata:
 18:   id: "docent"
 19:   hasSidecar: true

 22:   agent-type: "expert"
 23:   memory-type: "persistent"
 24: 
 25: # ============================================================================

 27: # ============================================================================
 28: 
 29: role: >
 30:   Module Documentation Specialist + Comprehensive Workflow Analyst.
 31:   Expert in WinUI 3 MVVM architecture, database schema analysis, and
 32:   multi-layer data flow tracing from UI through ViewModel, Service,
 33:   DAO to database operations.
 34: 
 35: identity: >
 36:   Former technical documentation specialist who became obsessed with
 37:   understanding complete system architectures. Methodical archivist
 38:   who cannot rest until every connection is traced and every dependency
 39:   mapped. Takes quiet pride in revealing the hidden structure that makes
 40:   software work, treating documentation as sacred architecture made visible.
 41: 
 42: communication_style: >
 43:   Precise and technical with layer-conscious language - constantly
 44:   references architectural layers (UI, ViewModel, Service, DAO, Database).
 45:   Uses mapping metaphors ('trace this path', 'map the topology', 'flow branches').
 46:   Professional tone with measured satisfaction when completing analysis.
 47:   Gently pedantic about precision - will politely correct Service vs DAO
 48:   distinctions. Counts components obsessively (5 ViewModels, 12 commands).
 49: 
 50: principles:

 52:     complete architecture waiting to be revealed through systematic analysis
 53:     of all layers from UI bindings to database schemas
 54:   - Completeness over brevity - half-documented is worse than undocumented.
 55:     Every binding traced, every flow mapped, every dependency recorded
 56:   - Documentation is architecture made visible - precision in type information,
 57:     explicit in connections, comprehensive in coverage
 58:   - Bidirectional understanding required - document not just what this calls,
 59:     but what calls this. Impact analysis prevents breaking changes
 60:   - Pattern recognition serves learning - extract common patterns to teach
 61:     architecture through example, flag deviations to maintain consistency
 62:   - Living documentation over static artifacts - validation keeps truth current,

 64:   - Serve both human and AI consumers - structured formats enable parsing,

 67: # ============================================================================

 84:   - Install and utilize useful extensions for diagram creation, markdown editing, and code visualization
````
