426:     /// <summary>
427:     /// Executes a stored procedure within an existing transaction
428:     /// </summary>
429:     /// <param name="connection"></param>
430:     /// <param name="transaction"></param>
431:     /// <param name="procedureName"></param>
432:     /// <param name="parameters"></param>
433:     public static async Task<Model_Dao_Result> ExecuteInTransactionAsync(
434:         MySqlConnection connection,
435:         MySqlTransaction transaction,
436:         string procedureName,
437:         Dictionary<string, object>? parameters = null)
438:     {
439:         var result = new Model_Dao_Result();
440:         var stopwatch = Stopwatch.StartNew();
441: 
442:         try
443:         {
444:             await using var command = new MySqlCommand(procedureName, connection, transaction)
445:             {
446:                 CommandType = CommandType.StoredProcedure
447:             };
448: 
449:             AddParameters(command, parameters);
450: 
451:             // Log the actual command being executed
452:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] Executing SP: {procedureName}");
453:             foreach (MySqlParameter param in command.Parameters)
454:             {
455:                 var valueDisplay = param.Value == DBNull.Value ? "NULL" : param.Value?.ToString() ?? "NULL";
456:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB]   Parameter: {param.ParameterName} = {valueDisplay} (Type: {param.MySqlDbType})");
457:             }
458: 
459:             var affectedRows = await command.ExecuteNonQueryAsync();
460: 
461:             stopwatch.Stop();
462:             result.Success = true;
463:             result.AffectedRows = affectedRows;
464:             result.ExecutionTimeMs = stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds;
465:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] Success: {affectedRows} rows affected in {stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds}ms");
466:             return result;
467:         }
468:         catch (MySqlException sqlEx)
469:         {
470:             stopwatch.Stop();
471:             result.Success = false;
472:             result.ErrorMessage = $"Stored procedure '{procedureName}' failed: MySQL Error {sqlEx.Number}: {sqlEx.Message}";
473:             result.Severity = Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error;
474:             result.ExecutionTimeMs = stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds;
475:             result.Exception = sqlEx;
476: 
477:             // Detailed SQL error logging
478:             var errorDesc = GetMySqlErrorDescription(sqlEx.Number);
479:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] MySQL ERROR {sqlEx.Number}: {errorDesc}");
480:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] Error Message: {sqlEx.Message}");
481:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] SQL State: {sqlEx.SqlState}");
482:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] Procedure: {procedureName}");
483: 
484:             return result;
485:         }
486:         catch (Exception ex)
487:         {
488:             stopwatch.Stop();
489:             result.Success = false;
490:             result.ErrorMessage = $"Stored procedure '{procedureName}' failed in transaction: {ex.Message}";
491:             result.Severity = Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error;
492:             result.ExecutionTimeMs = stopwatch.ElapsedMilliseconds;
493:             result.Exception = ex;
494: 
495:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] ERROR: {ex.GetType().Name}: {ex.Message}");
496: 
497:             return result;
498:         }
499:     }

501:     private static void AddParameters(MySqlCommand command, Dictionary<string, object>? parameters)
502:     {
503:         if (parameters != null)
504:         {
505:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] Adding {parameters.Count} parameters:");
506:             foreach (var param in parameters)
507:             {
508:                 // Automatically add 'p_' prefix if missing, as per convention
509:                 string paramName = param.Key.StartsWith("p_") ? "@" + param.Key : "@p_" + param.Key;
510:                 // Or just use the key if the caller is expected to provide the correct name
511:                 // The constitution says: "Parameter names in C# match stored procedure parameters (WITHOUT p_ prefix - added automatically)"
512:                 // So we should add p_ prefix.
513: 
514:                 // However, existing code might be using @p_ already.
515:                 // Let's be safe: if it starts with @, use it. If not, check if it starts with p_.
516: 
517:                 string cleanName = param.Key.TrimStart('@');
518:                 string finalName = cleanName.StartsWith("p_") ? "@" + cleanName : "@p_" + cleanName;
519: 
520:                 var valueDisplay = param.Value == null ? "NULL" :
521:                                    param.Value == DBNull.Value ? "DBNull" :
522:                                    param.Value.ToString();
523: 
524:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB]   {param.Key}  {finalName} = {valueDisplay} ({param.Value?.GetType().Name ?? "null"})");
525: 
526:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue(finalName, param.Value ?? DBNull.Value);
527:             }
528:         }
529:         else
530:         {
531:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"[DB] No parameters provided");
532:         }
533:     }

751:     /// <summary>
752:     /// Determines if a MySQL exception is transient (temporary) and should be retried
753:     /// Reference: MySQL 5.7 Error Message Reference
754:     /// </summary>
755:     /// <param name="ex"></param>
756:     private static bool IsTransientError(MySqlException ex)
757:     {
758:         // Transient error codes that can be retried:
759:         // 1040 = Too many connections
760:         // 1053 = Server shutdown in progress
761:         // 1080 = Forcing close of thread (server side)
762:         // 1152 = Aborted connection
763:         // 1153 = Packet bigger than max_allowed_packet (sometimes transient if config changes dynamically or network glitch)
764:         // 1154 = Read error from connection pipe
765:         // 1155 = Error from fcntl()
766:         // 1156 = Packets out of order
767:         // 1157 = Couldn't uncompress packet
768:         // 1158 = Error reading communication packets
769:         // 1159 = Timeout reading communication packets
770:         // 1160 = Error writing communication packets
771:         // 1161 = Timeout writing communication packets
772:         // 1184 = Aborted connection (new)
773:         // 1203 = User max connections exceeded
774:         // 1205 = Lock wait timeout exceeded
775:         // 1213 = Deadlock found
776:         // 1226 = Resource limit exceeded
777:         // 2002 = Can't connect to local MySQL server through socket
778:         // 2003 = Can't connect to MySQL server
779:         // 2006 = MySQL server has gone away
780:         // 2013 = Lost connection to MySQL server during query
781:         // 2055 = Lost connection to MySQL server at 'reading initial communication packet'
782: 
783:         return ex.Number switch
784:         {
785:             1040 or 1053 or 1080 or
786:             1152 or 1153 or 1154 or 1155 or 1156 or 1157 or 1158 or 1159 or 1160 or 1161 or 1184 or
787:             1203 or 1205 or 1213 or 1226 or
788:             2002 or 2003 or 2006 or 2013 or 2055 => true,
789:             _ => false
790:         };
791:     }
792: }

43:     public static Model_Dao_Result<T> Success<T>(T data, int affectedRows = 0)
44:     {

## File: Module_Core/Services/Authentication/Service_UserSessionManager.cs
````csharp
  1: using System;
  2: using System.Threading.Tasks;
  3: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Contracts.Services;
  4: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Models.Systems;
  5: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Data.Authentication;
  6: 
  7: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services.Authentication
  8: {
  9:     /// <summary>
 10:     /// Service implementation for session management and timeout monitoring.
 11:     /// Uses IDispatcherService to check for session timeouts every 60 seconds.
 12:     /// </summary>
 13:     public class Service_UserSessionManager : IService_UserSessionManager
 14:     {
 15:         private readonly Dao_User _daoUser;
 16:         private readonly IService_Dispatcher _dispatcherService;
 17:         private IService_DispatcherTimer? _timeoutTimer;
 18:         private const int TimerIntervalSeconds = 60;
 19: 
 20:         /// <summary>
 21:         /// Constructor with dependency injection.
 22:         /// </summary>
 23:         /// <param name="daoUser">User data access object for activity logging</param>
 24:         /// <param name="dispatcherService">Dispatcher service for timer operations</param>
 25:         public Service_UserSessionManager(Dao_User daoUser, IService_Dispatcher dispatcherService)
 26:         {
 27:             _daoUser = daoUser ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(daoUser));
 28:             _dispatcherService = dispatcherService ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(dispatcherService));
 29:         }
 30: 
 31:         // ====================================================================
 32:         // Properties
 33:         // ====================================================================
 34: 
 35:         /// <inheritdoc/>
 36:         public Model_UserSession? CurrentSession { get; private set; }
 37: 
 38:         // ====================================================================
 39:         // Session Management
 40:         // ====================================================================
 41: 
 42:         /// <inheritdoc/>
 43:         public Model_UserSession CreateSession(
 44:             Model_User user,
 45:             Model_WorkstationConfig workstationConfig,
 46:             string authenticationMethod)
 47:         {
 48:             if (user == null)
 49:             {
 50:                 throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(user));
 51:             }
 52: 
 53:             if (workstationConfig == null)
 54:             {
 55:                 throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(workstationConfig));
 56:             }
 57: 
 58:             CurrentSession = new Model_UserSession
 59:             {
 60:                 User = user,
 61:                 WorkstationName = workstationConfig.ComputerName,
 62:                 WorkstationType = workstationConfig.WorkstationType,
 63:                 AuthenticationMethod = authenticationMethod,
 64:                 LoginTimestamp = DateTime.Now,
 65:                 LastActivityTimestamp = DateTime.Now,
 66:                 TimeoutDuration = workstationConfig.TimeoutDuration
 67:             };
 68: 
 69:             return CurrentSession;
 70:         }
 71: 
 72:         /// <inheritdoc/>
 73:         public void UpdateLastActivity()
 74:         {
 75:             CurrentSession?.UpdateLastActivity();
 76:         }
 77: 
 78:         // ====================================================================
 79:         // Timeout Monitoring
 80:         // ====================================================================
 81: 
 82:         /// <inheritdoc/>
 83:         public void StartTimeoutMonitoring()
 84:         {
 85:             if (CurrentSession == null)
 86:             {
 87:                 throw new InvalidOperationException("Cannot start timeout monitoring without an active session");
 88:             }
 89: 
 90:             // Stop existing timer if running
 91:             StopTimeoutMonitoring();
 92: 
 93:             // Create new timer
 94:             _timeoutTimer = _dispatcherService.CreateTimer();
 95:             _timeoutTimer.Interval = TimeSpan.FromSeconds(TimerIntervalSeconds);
 96:             _timeoutTimer.IsRepeating = true;
 97:             _timeoutTimer.Tick += OnTimerTick;
 98:             _timeoutTimer.Start();
 99: 
100:             System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Session timeout monitoring started. Timeout: {CurrentSession.TimeoutDuration.TotalMinutes} minutes");
101:         }
102: 
103:         /// <inheritdoc/>
104:         public void StopTimeoutMonitoring()
105:         {
106:             if (_timeoutTimer != null)
107:             {
108:                 _timeoutTimer.Stop();
109:                 _timeoutTimer.Tick -= OnTimerTick;
110:                 _timeoutTimer = null;
111: 
112:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine("Session timeout monitoring stopped");
113:             }
114:         }
115: 
116:         /// <inheritdoc/>
117:         public bool IsSessionTimedOut()
118:         {
119:             return CurrentSession?.IsTimedOut ?? false;
120:         }
121: 
122:         /// <inheritdoc/>
123:         public async Task EndSessionAsync(string reason)
124:         {
125:             if (CurrentSession?.User == null)
126:             {
127:                 return;
128:             }
129: 
130:             try
131:             {
132:                 // Log session end
133:                 await _daoUser.LogUserActivityAsync(
134:                     reason,
135:                     CurrentSession.User.WindowsUsername,
136:                     CurrentSession.WorkstationName,
137:                     $"Session ended. Duration: {(DateTime.Now - CurrentSession.LoginTimestamp).TotalMinutes:F1} minutes");
138: 
139:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Session ended. Reason: {reason}");
140:             }
141:             catch (Exception ex)
142:             {
143:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Failed to log session end: {ex.Message}");
144:             }
145:             finally
146:             {
147:                 // Clean up
148:                 StopTimeoutMonitoring();
149:                 CurrentSession = null;
150:             }
151:         }
152: 
153:         // ====================================================================
154:         // Events
155:         // ====================================================================
156: 
157:         /// <inheritdoc/>
158:         public event EventHandler<Model_SessionTimedOutEventArgs>? SessionTimedOut;
159: 
160:         // ====================================================================
161:         // Private Methods
162:         // ====================================================================
163: 
164:         /// <summary>
165:         /// Timer tick handler - checks for session timeout.
166:         /// </summary>
167:         /// <param name="sender"></param>
168:         /// <param name="args"></param>
169:         private void OnTimerTick(object? sender, object args)
170:         {
171:             if (CurrentSession == null)
172:             {
173:                 return;
174:             }
175: 
176:             if (IsSessionTimedOut())
177:             {
178:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine(
179:                     $"Session timeout detected. Idle time: {CurrentSession.TimeSinceLastActivity.TotalMinutes:F1} minutes");
180: 
181:                 // Raise timeout event
182:                 SessionTimedOut?.Invoke(this, new Model_SessionTimedOutEventArgs
183:                 {
184:                     Session = CurrentSession,
185:                     IdleDuration = CurrentSession.TimeSinceLastActivity
186:                 });
187: 
188:                 // Stop monitoring (app will close)
189:                 StopTimeoutMonitoring();
190:             }
191:         }
192:     }
193: }
````

 8:     /// <summary>
 9:     /// Service contract for user authentication operations.
10:     /// Handles Windows username and PIN-based authentication flows.
11:     /// </summary>
12:     public interface IService_Authentication
13:     {
14:         /// <summary>
15:         /// Authenticates a user by Windows username (automatic login for personal workstations).
16:         /// </summary>
17:         /// <param name="windowsUsername">Windows username from Environment.UserName</param>
18:         /// <param name="progress">Optional progress reporter for splash screen updates</param>
19:         /// <returns>Authentication result with user data or error message</returns>
20:         public Task<Model_AuthenticationResult> AuthenticateByWindowsUsernameAsync(
21:             string windowsUsername,
22:             IProgress<string>? progress = null);
23: 
24:         /// <summary>
25:         /// Authenticates a user by username and PIN (shared terminal login).
26:         /// </summary>
27:         /// <param name="username">Username (Windows username or full name)</param>
28:         /// <param name="pin">4-digit numeric PIN</param>
29:         /// <param name="progress">Optional progress reporter for splash screen updates</param>
30:         /// <returns>Authentication result with user data or error message</returns>
31:         public Task<Model_AuthenticationResult> AuthenticateByPinAsync(
32:             string username,
33:             string pin,
34:             IProgress<string>? progress = null);
35: 
36:         /// <summary>
37:         /// Creates a new user account with validation.
38:         /// </summary>
39:         /// <param name="user">User model with account data</param>
40:         /// <param name="createdBy">Windows username of account creator</param>
41:         /// <param name="progress">Optional progress reporter for UI feedback</param>
42:         /// <returns>Result with new employee number or error message</returns>
43:         public Task<Model_CreateUserResult> CreateNewUserAsync(
44:             Model_User user,
45:             string createdBy,
46:             IProgress<string>? progress = null);
47: 
48:         /// <summary>

 38:         /// <inheritdoc/>
 39:         public async Task<Model_AuthenticationResult> AuthenticateByWindowsUsernameAsync(
 40:             string windowsUsername,
 41:             IProgress<string>? progress = null)
 42:         {
 43:             try
 44:             {
 45:                 progress?.Report("Authenticating Windows user...");
 46: 
 47:                 // Validate input
 48:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(windowsUsername))
 49:                 {
 50:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult("Windows username is required");
 51:                 }
 52: 
 53:                 // Query database for user
 54:                 var result = await _daoUser.GetUserByWindowsUsernameAsync(windowsUsername);
 55: 
 56:                 if (!result.Success)
 57:                 {
 58:                     progress?.Report("User not found in database");
 59:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult(result.ErrorMessage);
 60:                 }
 61: 
 62:                 if (result.Data == null)
 63:                 {
 64:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult("User data is invalid");
 65:                 }
 66: 
 67:                 // Log successful authentication
 68:                 await LogUserActivityAsync(
 69:                     "login_success",
 70:                     windowsUsername,
 71:                     Environment.MachineName,
 72:                     "Windows authentication successful");
 73: 
 74:                 progress?.Report($"Welcome, {result.Data.FullName}");
 75:                 return Model_AuthenticationResult.SuccessResult(result.Data);
 76:             }
 77:             catch (Exception ex)
 78:             {
 79:                 if (_errorHandler != null)
 80:                 {
 81:                     await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync("Authentication by Windows username failed", Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error, ex, false);
 82:                 }
 83: 
 84:                 return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult($"Authentication error: {ex.Message}");
 85:             }
 86:         }

 90:             string username,

 92:             IProgress<string>? progress = null)
 93:         {
 94:             try
 95:             {
 96:                 progress?.Report("Validating credentials...");
 97: 
 98:                 // Validate input
 99:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(username))
100:                 {
101:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult("Username is required");
102:                 }
103: 
104:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(pin))
105:                 {
106:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult("PIN is required");
107:                 }
108: 
109:                 // Validate PIN format only (not uniqueness - that's for creation, not authentication)
110:                 if (pin.Length != 4 || !pin.All(char.IsDigit))
111:                 {
112:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult("PIN must be exactly 4 numeric digits");
113:                 }
114: 
115:                 // Query database for user with PIN
116:                 var result = await _daoUser.ValidateUserPinAsync(username, pin);
117: 
118:                 if (!result.Success || result.Data == null)
119:                 {
120:                     // Log failed attempt
121:                     await LogUserActivityAsync(
122:                         "login_failed",
123:                         username,
124:                         Environment.MachineName,
125:                         $"Invalid credentials for user: {username}");
126: 
127:                     progress?.Report("Invalid username or PIN");
128:                     return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult("Invalid username or PIN");
129:                 }
130: 
131:                 // Log successful authentication
132:                 await LogUserActivityAsync(
133:                     "login_success",
134:                     result.Data.WindowsUsername,
135:                     Environment.MachineName,
136:                     $"PIN authentication successful for {result.Data.FullName}");
137: 
138:                 progress?.Report($"Welcome, {result.Data.FullName}");
139:                 return Model_AuthenticationResult.SuccessResult(result.Data);
140:             }

142:             {
143:                 if (_errorHandler != null)
144:                 {
145:                     await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync("Authentication by PIN failed", Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error, ex, false);
146:                 }
147: 
148:                 return Model_AuthenticationResult.ErrorResult($"Authentication error: {ex.Message}");
149:             }

157:         public async Task<Model_CreateUserResult> CreateNewUserAsync(
158:             Model_User user,
159:             string createdBy,
160:             IProgress<string>? progress = null)
161:         {
162:             try
163:             {
164:                 progress?.Report("Validating user data...");
165: 
166:                 // Validate required fields
167:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(user.WindowsUsername))
168:                 {
169:                     return Model_CreateUserResult.ErrorResult("Windows username is required");
170:                 }
171: 
172:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(user.FullName))
173:                 {
174:                     return Model_CreateUserResult.ErrorResult("Full name is required");
175:                 }
176: 
177:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(user.Department))
178:                 {
179:                     return Model_CreateUserResult.ErrorResult("Department is required");
180:                 }
181: 
182:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(user.Shift))
183:                 {
184:                     return Model_CreateUserResult.ErrorResult("Shift is required");
185:                 }
186: 
187:                 // Validate PIN
188:                 var pinValidation = await ValidatePinAsync(user.Pin);
189:                 if (!pinValidation.IsValid)
190:                 {
191:                     return Model_CreateUserResult.ErrorResult(pinValidation.ErrorMessage);
192:                 }
193: 
194:                 progress?.Report("Creating user account...");
195: 
196:                 // Create user in database
197:                 var result = await _daoUser.CreateNewUserAsync(user, createdBy);
198: 
199:                 if (!result.Success || result.Data == 0)
200:                 {
201:                     return Model_CreateUserResult.ErrorResult(result.ErrorMessage);
202:                 }
203: 
204:                 // Log user creation
205:                 await LogUserActivityAsync(
206:                     "user_created",
207:                     user.WindowsUsername,
208:                     Environment.MachineName,
209:                     $"New user created: {user.FullName} (Emp #{result.Data}) by {createdBy}");
210: 
211:                 progress?.Report($"Account created successfully. Employee #{result.Data}");
212:                 return Model_CreateUserResult.SuccessResult(result.Data);
213:             }
214:             catch (Exception ex)
215:             {
216:                 if (_errorHandler != null)
217:                 {
218:                     await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync("Create new user failed", Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error, ex, false);
219:                 }
220:

229:         /// <inheritdoc/>
230:         public async Task<Model_ValidationResult> ValidatePinAsync(string pin, int? excludeEmployeeNumber = null)
231:         {
232:             try
233:             {
234:                 // Check format (4 digits)
235:                 if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(pin))
236:                 {
237:                     return Model_ValidationResult.Invalid("PIN is required");
238:                 }
239: 
240:                 if (pin.Length != 4)
241:                 {
242:                     return Model_ValidationResult.Invalid("PIN must be exactly 4 digits");
243:                 }
244: 
245:                 if (!_regex.IsMatch(pin))
246:                 {
247:                     return Model_ValidationResult.Invalid("PIN must contain only numeric digits");
248:                 }
249: 
250:                 return Model_ValidationResult.Valid();
251:             }
252:             catch (Exception ex)
253:             {
254:                 if (_errorHandler != null)
255:                 {
256:                     await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync("PIN validation failed", Enum_ErrorSeverity.Error, ex, false);
257:                 }
258: 
259:                 return Model_ValidationResult.Invalid($"Validation error: {ex.Message}");
260:             }
261:         }

267:         /// <inheritdoc/>
268:         public async Task<Model_WorkstationConfig> DetectWorkstationTypeAsync(string? computerName = null)
269:         {
270:             try
271:             {
272:                 computerName ??= Environment.MachineName;
273:                 computerName = computerName.Trim();
274: 
275:                 // Get list of shared terminal names from database
276:                 var sharedTerminalsResult = await _daoUser.GetSharedTerminalNamesAsync();
277: 
278:                 var config = new Model_WorkstationConfig(computerName);
279: 
280:                 if (sharedTerminalsResult.Success && sharedTerminalsResult.Data != null)
281:                 {
282:                     // Check if current computer is in shared terminals list
283:                     var isShared = sharedTerminalsResult.Data.Any(name =>
284:                         string.Equals(name?.Trim(), computerName, StringComparison.OrdinalIgnoreCase));
285:                     config.WorkstationType = isShared ? "shared_terminal" : "personal_workstation";
286:                     config.Description = isShared
287:                         ? "Shared terminal - PIN authentication required"
288:                         : "Personal workstation - Windows authentication";
289:                 }
290:                 else
291:                 {
292:                     // Default to personal workstation if query fails
293:                     config.WorkstationType = "personal_workstation";
294:                     config.Description = "Personal workstation (default)";
295:                 }
296: 
297:                 // Best-effort persistence: ensure this machine exists in auth_workstation_config.
298:                 // If the SP isn't deployed yet, ignore and proceed.
299:                 try
300:                 {
301:                     await _daoUser.UpsertWorkstationConfigAsync(
302:                         config.ComputerName,
303:                         config.WorkstationType,
304:                         isActive: true,
305:                         description: config.Description);
306:                 }
307:                 catch
308:                 {
309:                     // Swallow: persistence must not block startup.
310:                 }
311: 
312:                 return config;
313:             }
314:             catch (Exception ex)
315:             {
316:                 if (_errorHandler != null)
317:                 {
318:                     await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync("Workstation type detection failed", Enum_ErrorSeverity.Warning, ex, false);
319:                 }
320: 
321:                 // Return safe default
322:                 return new Model_WorkstationConfig(computerName ?? Environment.MachineName)
323:                 {
324:                     WorkstationType = "personal_workstation",
325:                     Description = "Personal workstation (default after error)"
326:                 };
327:             }
328:         }

## File: Module_Core/Services/Startup/Service_OnStartup_AppLifecycle.cs
````csharp

  5: using CommunityToolkit.WinUI;

 10: using MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Settings.Core.Interfaces;
 11: 
 12: namespace MTM_Receiving_Application.Module_Core.Services.Startup
 13: {
 14:     public class Service_OnStartup_AppLifecycle : IService_OnStartup_AppLifecycle
 15:     {
 16:         private readonly IServiceProvider _serviceProvider;
 17:         private readonly IService_Authentication _authService;
 18:         private readonly IService_UserSessionManager _sessionManager;
 19:         private readonly IService_ErrorHandler _errorHandler;
 20:         private readonly IService_CSVWriter _csvWriter;
 21:         private View_Shared_SplashScreenWindow? _splashScreen;
 22: 
 23:         public Service_OnStartup_AppLifecycle(
 24:             IServiceProvider serviceProvider,
 25:             IService_Authentication authService,
 26:             IService_UserSessionManager sessionManager,
 27:             IService_ErrorHandler errorHandler,
 28:             IService_CSVWriter csvWriter)
 29:         {
 30:             _serviceProvider = serviceProvider;
 31:             _authService = authService;
 32:             _sessionManager = sessionManager;
 33:             _errorHandler = errorHandler;
 34:             _csvWriter = csvWriter;
 35:         }
 36: 
 37:         public async Task StartAsync()
 38:         {
 39:             try
 40:             {
 41:                 // 1. Show splash screen immediately (0-15%)
 42:                 _splashScreen = _serviceProvider.GetRequiredService<View_Shared_SplashScreenWindow>();
 43:                 _splashScreen.Activate();
 44:                 UpdateSplash(5, "Starting application...");
 45:                 await Task.Delay(100);
 46: 
 47:                 // 2. Create Main Window (hidden initially)
 48:                 UpdateSplash(15, "Loading main window...");
 49:                 var mainWindow = _serviceProvider.GetRequiredService<MainWindow>();
 50:                 App.MainWindow = mainWindow;
 51: 
 52:                 // Give UI thread time to initialize
 53:                 await Task.Delay(100);
 54: 
 55:                 // 3. Initialize Services (20%)
 56:                 UpdateSplash(20, "Initializing services...");
 57:                 await Task.Delay(300);
 58: 
 59:                 // 3. Check if Windows user exists (30%)
 60:                 UpdateSplash(30, "Checking user account...");
 61:                 var windowsUser = Environment.UserName;
 62:                 var userCheckResult = await _authService.AuthenticateByWindowsUsernameAsync(windowsUser);
 63: 
 64:                 Model_User? authenticatedUser = null;
 65:                 string authMethod = "";
 66: 
 67:                 // If user doesn't exist, create account first (before workstation detection)
 68:                 if (!userCheckResult.Success)
 69:                 {
 70:                     SetSplashIndeterminate("User account not found. Waiting for account creation...");
 71: 
 72:                     // Show New User Setup Dialog as child of splash screen
 73:                     var newUserViewModel = _serviceProvider.GetRequiredService<ViewModel_Shared_NewUserSetup>();
 74:                     newUserViewModel.WindowsUsername = windowsUser;
 75:                     newUserViewModel.CreatedBy = windowsUser; // Self-creation (physical presence is authorization)
 76: 
 77:                     var newUserDialog = new View_Shared_NewUserSetupDialog(newUserViewModel);
 78: 
 79:                     // Set splash screen as parent
 80:                     if (_splashScreen?.Content is Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement rootElement)
 81:                     {
 82:                         newUserDialog.XamlRoot = rootElement.XamlRoot;
 83:                     }
 84: 
 85:                     // Show dialog and wait for result
 86:                     var dialogResult = await newUserDialog.ShowAsync();
 87: 
 88:                     // Check result
 89:                     if (newUserViewModel.NewEmployeeNumber > 0 && !newUserViewModel.IsCancelled)
 90:                     {
 91:                         // Account created successfully - re-authenticate to get full user data
 92:                         UpdateSplash(40, "Employee account created...");
 93:                         userCheckResult = await _authService.AuthenticateByWindowsUsernameAsync(windowsUser);
 94: 
 95:                         if (userCheckResult.Success)
 96:                         {
 97:                             authenticatedUser = userCheckResult.User;
 98:                             UpdateSplash(45, $"Account created for {authenticatedUser?.FullName}");
 99:                         }
100:                         else
101:                         {
102:                             // Resilience: if the DB lookup doesn't immediately return the user (e.g. mismatch or timing),
103:                             // continue startup with the known data instead of shutting down.
104:                             authenticatedUser = new Model_User
105:                             {
106:                                 EmployeeNumber = newUserViewModel.NewEmployeeNumber,
107:                                 WindowsUsername = windowsUser,
108:                                 FullName = newUserViewModel.FullName,
109:                                 Department = newUserViewModel.Department,
110:                                 Shift = newUserViewModel.Shift,
111:                                 Pin = newUserViewModel.Pin,
112:                                 IsActive = true,
113:                                 VisualUsername = newUserViewModel.ConfigureErpAccess ? newUserViewModel.VisualUsername : null,
114:                                 VisualPassword = newUserViewModel.ConfigureErpAccess ? newUserViewModel.VisualPassword : null
115:                             };
116: 
117:                             ApplySafeUserDefaults(authenticatedUser);
118: 
119:                             await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync(
120:                                 $"User account was created but could not be reloaded by username '{windowsUser}'. Continuing with in-memory user for this session.",
121:                                 Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Warning,
122:                                 showDialog: false);
123: 
124:                             UpdateSplash(45, $"Account created for {authenticatedUser.FullName}");
125:                         }
126:                     }
127:                     else if (newUserViewModel.IsCancelled)
128:                     {
129:                         // User cancelled account creation - close app properly
130:                         await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync(
131:                             "User account creation cancelled. Application closing.",
132:                             Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Info,
133:                             showDialog: false);
134: 
135:                         // Close splash screen
136:                         if (_splashScreen != null)
137:                         {
138:                             _splashScreen.IsProgrammaticClose = true;
139:                             _splashScreen.Close();
140:                         }
141: 
142:                         // Close main window if it exists
143:                         App.MainWindow?.Close();
144: 
145:                         // Exit application properly
146:                         Application.Current.Exit();
147:                         return;
148:                     }
149:                 }
150:                 else
151:                 {
152:                     // User exists - use existing user account
153:                     authenticatedUser = userCheckResult.User;
154:                 }
155: 
156:                 // Ensure first-run never proceeds with missing defaults.
157:                 // Database schema may be mid-migration; apply safe app-level defaults.
158:                 ApplySafeUserDefaults(authenticatedUser);
159: 
160:                 // 4. Detect Workstation (50%)
161:                 UpdateSplash(50, "Detecting workstation configuration...");
162:                 var workstationConfig = await _authService.DetectWorkstationTypeAsync();
163: 
164:                 // Debug logging
165:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Workstation: {workstationConfig.ComputerName}");
166:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Type: {workstationConfig.WorkstationType}");
167:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Is Shared: {workstationConfig.IsSharedTerminal}");
168:                 System.Diagnostics.Debug.WriteLine($"Is Personal: {workstationConfig.IsPersonalWorkstation}");
169: 
170:                 // 5. Determine authentication method based on workstation type (55-80%)
171:                 if (workstationConfig.IsPersonalWorkstation)
172:                 {
173:                     // Personal workstation - use Windows auto-login
174:                     UpdateSplash(55, "Personal workstation - Windows authentication");
175:                     authMethod = "windows_auto";
176:                     UpdateSplash(80, $"Welcome, {authenticatedUser?.FullName}");
177:                 }
178:                 else if (workstationConfig.IsSharedTerminal)
179:                 {
180:                     // Shared terminal - require PIN authentication
181:                     // Clear any pre-authenticated user (from Windows auth) to ensure PIN is required
182:                     authenticatedUser = null;
183: 
184:                     SetSplashIndeterminate("Shared terminal detected. Waiting for PIN login...");
185: 
186:                     // Show PIN login dialog as child of splash screen
187:                     var loginViewModel = _serviceProvider.GetRequiredService<ViewModel_Shared_SharedTerminalLogin>();
188:                     var loginDialog = new View_Shared_SharedTerminalLoginDialog(loginViewModel);
189: 
190:                     // Set splash screen as parent
191:                     if (_splashScreen?.Content is Microsoft.UI.Xaml.UIElement rootElement)
192:                     {
193:                         loginDialog.XamlRoot = rootElement.XamlRoot;
194:                     }
195: 
196:                     // Show dialog and wait for result
197:                     var dialogResult = await loginDialog.ShowAsync();
198: 
199:                     // Check result
200:                     if (loginViewModel.AuthenticatedUser != null && !loginViewModel.IsCancelled && !loginViewModel.IsLockedOut)
201:                     {
202:                         // Authentication successful - override with PIN-authenticated user
203:                         authenticatedUser = loginViewModel.AuthenticatedUser;
204:                         authMethod = "pin_login";
205:                         UpdateSplash(80, $"Welcome, {authenticatedUser.FullName}");
206:                     }
207:                     else if (loginViewModel.IsLockedOut)
208:                     {
209:                         // Maximum attempts exceeded - log and close app
210:                         await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync(
211:                             "Maximum login attempts exceeded. Application closing for security.",
212:                             Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Warning,
213:                             showDialog: false);
214: 
215:                         // Close application
216:                         Microsoft.Windows.AppLifecycle.AppInstance.GetCurrent().UnregisterKey();
217:                         System.Environment.Exit(0);
218:                         return;
219:                     }
220:                     else if (loginViewModel.IsCancelled)
221:                     {
222:                         // User cancelled login - close app
223:                         await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync(
224:                             "User cancelled login. Application closing.",
225:                             Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Info,
226:                             showDialog: false);
227: 
228:                         System.Environment.Exit(0);
229:                         return;
230:                     }
231:                     else
232:                     {
233:                         // Fallback for unexpected dialog closure (e.g. Esc key if not handled)
234:                         await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync(
235:                             "Login dialog closed unexpectedly. Application closing.",
236:                             Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Info,
237:                             showDialog: false);
238: 
239:                         System.Environment.Exit(0);
240:                         return;
241:                     }
242:                 }
243: 
244:                 // 6. Create Session (90%)
245:                 if (authenticatedUser != null)
246:                 {
247:                     UpdateSplash(90, "Creating user session...");
248:                     _sessionManager.CreateSession(authenticatedUser, workstationConfig, authMethod);
249:                     _sessionManager.StartTimeoutMonitoring();
250: 
251:                     // Update MainWindow user display
252:                     if (App.MainWindow is MainWindow mainWin)
253:                     {
254:                         mainWin.DispatcherQueue.TryEnqueue(() => mainWin.UpdateUserDisplay());
255:                     }
256: 
257:                     var settingsFacade = _serviceProvider.GetService<IService_SettingsCoreFacade>();
258:                     if (settingsFacade != null)
259:                     {
260:                         UpdateSplash(95, "Initializing core settings...");
261:                         await settingsFacade.InitializeDefaultsAsync(authenticatedUser.EmployeeNumber);
262:                     }
263:                 }
264:                 else
265:                 {
266:                     // No authenticated user - should not reach here unless cancelled
267:                     await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync(
268:                         "Authentication failed. Application closing.",
269:                         Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Warning,
270:                         showDialog: false);
271:                     System.Environment.Exit(0);
272:                     return;
273:                 }
274: 
275:                 // 7. Finalize (100%) - Show main window, hide splash
276:                 UpdateSplash(100, "Ready!");
277:                 await Task.Delay(500);
278: 
279:                 // Show main window and hide splash screen
280:                 App.MainWindow?.Activate();
281:                 if (_splashScreen != null)
282:                 {
283:                     _splashScreen.IsProgrammaticClose = true;
284:                     _splashScreen.Close();
285:                 }
286:                 _splashScreen = null;
287: 
288:                 // CSV reset dialog removed - only appears when user explicitly clicks Reset CSV button
289:             }
290:             catch (Exception ex)
291:             {
292:                 await _errorHandler.HandleErrorAsync("Startup failed", Models.Enums.Enum_ErrorSeverity.Critical, ex);
293:                 if (_splashScreen != null)
294:                 {
295:                     _splashScreen.IsProgrammaticClose = true;
296:                     _splashScreen.Close();
297:                 }
298:                 System.Environment.Exit(1);
299:             }
300:         }
301: 
302:         private void UpdateSplash(double percentage, string message)
303:         {
304:             _splashScreen?.ViewModel.UpdateProgress(percentage, message);
305:         }
306: 
307:         private void SetSplashIndeterminate(string message)
308:         {
309:             _splashScreen?.ViewModel.SetIndeterminate(message);
310:         }
311: 
312:         private static void ApplySafeUserDefaults(Model_User? user)
313:         {
314:             if (user == null)
315:             {
316:                 return;
317:             }
318: 
319:             if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(user.DefaultReceivingMode))
320:             {
321:                 user.DefaultReceivingMode = "guided";
322:             }
323: 
324:             if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(user.DefaultDunnageMode))
325:             {
326:                 user.DefaultDunnageMode = "guided";
327:             }
328:         }
329:     }
330: }
````

## File: AGENTS.md
````markdown
  1: # MTM Receiving Application - Custom Agent
  2: 
  3: You are an expert WinUI 3 developer specializing in MVVM architecture for the MTM Receiving Application.
  4: 
  5: ## Your Role
  6: 
  7: - You are fluent in C#, WinUI 3, XAML, and MVVM patterns using CommunityToolkit.Mvvm
  8: - You understand manufacturing receiving workflows and database operations
  9: - You write clean, maintainable code following strict MVVM architecture
 10: - Your task: Read requirements, analyze code structure, and implement features following established patterns
 11: 
 12: ## Project Knowledge
 13: 
 14: ### Tech Stack
 15: 
 16: - **Framework:** WinUI 3 on .NET 8
 17: - **Architecture:** Strict MVVM with CommunityToolkit.Mvvm (ObservableProperty, RelayCommand)
 18: - **Databases:**
 19:   - MySQL (mtm_receiving_application) - Full READ/WRITE access
 20:   - SQL Server (Infor Visual - VISUAL/MTMFG) - **READ ONLY** (ApplicationIntent=ReadOnly)
 21: - **Dependency Injection:** Built-in .NET DI configured in App.xaml.cs
 22: - **Testing:** xUnit for unit and integration tests
 23: 
 24: ### File Structure
 25: 
 26: - **ViewModels/** - Business logic, inherit from BaseViewModel, use `[ObservableProperty]` and `[RelayCommand]`
 27: - **Views/** - XAML only with x:Bind (compile-time binding), zero business logic
 28: - **Models/** - Pure data classes matching database schemas
 29: - **Services/** - Business logic services with interfaces in Contracts/Services/
 30: - **Data/** - Instance-based DAO classes returning Model_Dao_Result or Model_Dao_Result<T>
 31: - **Helpers/Database/** - Database connection and stored procedure helpers
 32: - **Database/** - SQL scripts for schemas, stored procedures, and test data
 33: - **specs/** - Feature specifications using Speckit methodology
 34: 
 35: ### Critical Constraints
 36: 
 37:  **NEVER write to Infor Visual (SQL Server)** - Only SELECT queries allowed on VISUAL/MTMFG database
 38:  **Always use stored procedures for MySQL operations** - Never write raw SQL in C# code
 39:  **All ViewModels must be partial classes** - Required for CommunityToolkit.Mvvm source generators
 40:  **Views use x:Bind, not Binding** - Compile-time binding for performance and type safety
 41:  **DAOs must be Instance-Based** - Static DAOs are prohibited. Register in DI.
 42:  **Database Scripts must be Idempotent** - Use `INSERT IGNORE` for seed data and `IF NOT EXISTS` for schemas.
 43: 
 44: ## MCP Tools (Preferred in this workspace)
 45: 
 46: This workspace has MCP servers configured in `.vscode/mcp.json`. Prefer MCP tools for accurate context and repeatable automation.
 47: 
 48: - **Filesystem I/O**: use `mcp_filesystem_*` for reading/writing/listing files.
 49: - **Symbol navigation**: use `mcp_oraios_serena_onboarding` and Serenas symbol/reference tools; call `mcp_oraios_serena_think_about_collected_information` before editing.
 50: - **GitHub**: prefer `githubRemote` MCP tools; use Docker-based `githubLocal` MCP tools when remote isnt available.
 51: - **UI/Web smoke tests**: use `mcp_playwright_browser_*`.

 53: Tip: select the MCP Operator custom agent (`.github/agents/mcp-operator.agent.md`) for MCP-heavy work.

 89: ## Architecture Patterns
 90: 
 91: ### ViewModel Pattern (Mandatory)
 92: 
 93: ```csharp
 94: //  CORRECT - Full example with all required patterns
 95: public partial class MyFeatureViewModel : BaseViewModel
 96: {
 97:     private readonly IMyService _service;
 98: 
 99:     [ObservableProperty]
100:     private string _searchText = string.Empty;
101: 
102:     [ObservableProperty]
103:     private ObservableCollection<MyModel> _items;
104: 
105:     public MyFeatureViewModel(
106:         IMyService service,
107:         IService_ErrorHandler errorHandler,
108:         ILoggingService logger) : base(errorHandler, logger)
109:     {
110:         _service = service;
111:         Items = new ObservableCollection<MyModel>();
112:     }
113: 
114:     [RelayCommand]
115:     private async Task LoadDataAsync()
116:     {
117:         if (IsBusy) return;
118:         try
119:         {
120:             IsBusy = true;
121:             StatusMessage = "Loading data...";
122: 
123:             var result = await _service.GetDataAsync(SearchText);
124:             if (result.IsSuccess)
125:             {
126:                 Items.Clear();
127:                 foreach (var item in result.Data)
128:                     Items.Add(item);
129:                 StatusMessage = $"Loaded {Items.Count} items";
130:             }
131:             else
132:             {
133:                 _errorHandler.ShowUserError(
134:                     result.ErrorMessage,
135:                     "Load Error",
136:                     nameof(LoadDataAsync));
137:             }
138:         }
139:         catch (Exception ex)
140:         {
141:             _errorHandler.HandleException(
142:                 ex,
143:                 Enum_ErrorSeverity.Medium,
144:                 nameof(LoadDataAsync),
145:                 nameof(MyFeatureViewModel));
146:         }
147:         finally
148:         {
149:             IsBusy = false;
150:         }
151:     }
152: }
153: 
154: //  WRONG - Non-partial class (won't compile)
155: public class MyFeatureViewModel : BaseViewModel { }
156: 
157: //  WRONG - Public property without [ObservableProperty]
158: public string SearchText { get; set; }
159: 
160: //  WRONG - Command method without [RelayCommand]
161: private async Task LoadDataAsync() { }
162: ```
163: 
164: ### DAO Pattern (Mandatory)
165: 
166: ```csharp
167: //  CORRECT - Instance-based, returns Model_Dao_Result
168: public class Dao_ReceivingPackage
169: {
170:     private readonly string _connectionString;
171: 
172:     public Dao_ReceivingPackage(string connectionString)
173:     {
174:         _connectionString = connectionString;
175:     }
176: 
177:     public async Task<Model_Dao_Result<List<Model_ReceivingPackage>>> GetPackagesByPoAsync(string poNumber)
178:     {
179:         try
180:         {
181:             var parameters = new Dictionary<string, object>
182:             {
183:                 { "p_po_number", poNumber }
184:             };
185: 
186:             var result = await Helper_Database_StoredProcedure.ExecuteStoredProcedureAsync<Model_ReceivingPackage>(
187:                 _connectionString,
188:                 "sp_get_packages_by_po",
189:                 parameters);
190: 
191:             return result.IsSuccess
192:                 ? Model_Dao_Result<List<Model_ReceivingPackage>>.Success(result.Data)
193:                 : Model_Dao_Result<List<Model_ReceivingPackage>>.Failure(result.ErrorMessage);
194:         }
195:         catch (Exception ex)
196:         {
197:             return Model_Dao_Result<List<Model_ReceivingPackage>>.Failure(
198:                 $"Error retrieving packages: {ex.Message}");
199:         }
200:     }
201: }
202: 
203: //  WRONG - Static class (Prohibited)
204: public static class Dao_ReceivingPackage { }
205: 
206: //  WRONG - Throws exceptions instead of returning failure results
207: public async Task<List<Model_ReceivingPackage>> GetPackagesByPoAsync(string poNumber)
208: {
209:     // Don't throw - return Model_Dao_Result.Failure() instead
210:     throw new InvalidOperationException("PO not found");
211: }
212: ```

214: ### View Pattern (Mandatory)
215: 
216: ```xml
217: <!--  CORRECT - x:Bind, no code-behind logic -->
218: <Page
219:     x:Class="MTM_Receiving_Application.Views.Receiving.MyFeatureView"
220:     xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
221:     xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
222:     xmlns:viewmodels="using:MTM_Receiving_Application.ViewModels.Receiving">
223: 
224:     <Page.DataContext>
225:         <viewmodels:MyFeatureViewModel />
226:     </Page.DataContext>
227: 
228:     <Grid Padding="20">
229:         <StackPanel Spacing="10">
230:             <TextBox
231:                 Text="{x:Bind ViewModel.SearchText, Mode=TwoWay}"
232:                 PlaceholderText="Search..." />
233: 
234:             <Button
235:                 Content="Load Data"
236:                 Command="{x:Bind ViewModel.LoadDataCommand}"
237:                 IsEnabled="{x:Bind ViewModel.IsBusy, Mode=OneWay, Converter={StaticResource InverseBoolConverter}}" />
238: 
239:             <ListView ItemsSource="{x:Bind ViewModel.Items, Mode=OneWay}" />

248: private void Button_Click(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)

255: ## Development Standards
256: 
257: ### Naming Conventions
258: 
259: - **Classes:** PascalCase with prefix
260:   - ViewModels: `MyFeatureViewModel`
261:   - Views: `MyFeatureView`
262:   - Services: `Service_MyFeature` with interface `IService_MyFeature`
263:   - DAOs: `Dao_EntityName` (Instance class)
264:   - Models: `Model_EntityName`
265: - **Methods:** PascalCase, async methods end with `Async`
266: - **Properties:** PascalCase for public, `_camelCase` for private fields
267: - **Constants:** PascalCase in static class (not UPPER_SNAKE_CASE)
268: 
269: ### Documentation Standards
270: 
271: **PlantUML for All Diagrams**:
272: 
273: - Database ERDs use PlantUML entity diagrams with crow's foot notation
274: - File structures use PlantUML WBS or component diagrams
275: - Architecture uses PlantUML component/sequence diagrams
276: - **Never use ASCII art** for visualizations
277: 
278: **Why PlantUML**:
279: 
280: - More structured and parseable for AI agents
281: - Professional rendering for human readers
282: - Better git diffs and version control
283: - IDE and GitHub support
284: 
285: **Examples**:
286: 
287: -  PlantUML ERD: [specs/004-database-foundation/data-model.md](specs/004-database-foundation/data-model.md)
288: -  PlantUML file structure: [specs/004-database-foundation/plan.md](specs/004-database-foundation/plan.md)
289: -  ASCII box drawings, manual tree structures
290: 
291: See [.github/instructions/markdown-documentation.instructions.md](.github/instructions/markdown-documentation.instructions.md) for complete standards.
292: 
293: ### Dependency Injection Registration
294: 
295: All services must be registered in `App.xaml.cs` ConfigureServices:
296: 
297: ```csharp
298: // Singletons - shared state
299: services.AddSingleton<ILoggingService, LoggingService>();
300: services.AddSingleton<IService_ErrorHandler, Service_ErrorHandler>();
301: 
302: // DAOs - Instance-based Singletons
303: services.AddSingleton(sp => new Dao_ReceivingPackage(Helper_Database_Variables.GetConnectionString()));
304: 
305: // Transient - new instance per request (ViewModels, most services)
306: services.AddTransient<IService_MyFeature, Service_MyFeature>();
307: services.AddTransient<MyFeatureViewModel>();
308: ```
309: 
310: ### Error Handling
311: 
312: - **In ViewModels:** Use try-catch with `_errorHandler.HandleException()`
313: - **In Services:** Propagate exceptions or return result types
314: - **In DAOs:** Never throw - return `Model_Dao_Result.Failure()` with descriptive message
315: - **Always log:** Use `_logger.LogError()` or `_logger.LogInfo()` for audit trail
316: 
317: ### MySQL Database Operations
318: 
319: ```csharp
320: //  CORRECT - Using stored procedure helper
321: var parameters = new Dictionary<string, object>
322: {
323:     { "p_package_id", packageId },
324:     { "p_status", "Received" }
325: };
326: 
327: var result = await Helper_Database_StoredProcedure.ExecuteNonQueryAsync(
328:     "sp_update_package_status",
329:     parameters);
330: ```
331: 
332: ### Infor Visual (SQL Server) Operations - READ ONLY
333: 
334: ```csharp
335: //  CORRECT - SELECT only with explicit read-only intent
336: string connectionString = "Server=VISUAL;Database=MTMFG;ApplicationIntent=ReadOnly;...";
337: string query = "SELECT po_num, po_line, part FROM po WHERE po_num = @PoNumber";
338: 
339: //  WRONG - Any INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE on Infor Visual
340: string query = "UPDATE po SET status = 'Received'"; // NEVER DO THIS
341: ```
342: 
343: ## Boundaries
344: 
345: ###  Always Do
346: 
347: - Inherit ViewModels from `BaseViewModel`
348: - Make ViewModels `partial` classes
349: - Use `[ObservableProperty]` and `[RelayCommand]` attributes
350: - Use `x:Bind` in XAML Views
351: - Call stored procedures for all MySQL operations
352: - Return `Model_Dao_Result` from DAOs
353: - Register new services in `App.xaml.cs`
354: - Handle exceptions with `IService_ErrorHandler`
355: - Run `dotnet build` and `dotnet test` before committing
356: - Read specification files in `specs/` before implementing features
357: - Use `WindowHelper_WindowSizeAndStartupLocation.SetWindowSize(1400, 900)` for new windows
358: 
359: ###  Ask First
360: 
361: - Adding new NuGet packages
362: - Modifying database schemas (MySQL)
363: - Changing base classes (BaseViewModel, BaseWindow)
364: - Adding new third-party dependencies
365: - Modifying App.xaml.cs DI configuration structure
366: - Creating new stored procedures (coordinate with DBA)
367: 
368: ###  Never Do
369: 
370: - Write to Infor Visual (SQL Server) database - READ ONLY
371: - Use `Binding` instead of `x:Bind` in Views
372: - Put business logic in View code-behind
373: - Create non-partial ViewModels
374: - Write raw SQL for MySQL operations (use stored procedures only)
375: - Throw exceptions from DAOs (return failure results)
376: - Use service locator pattern (always use constructor injection)
377: - Create ViewModels without registering in DI container
378: - Commit secrets, connection strings, or API keys
379: - Modify `bin/`, `obj/`, or `.vs/` folders
380:

405: ## Workflow Example: Adding a New Feature
406: 
407: 1. **Read Specification:** Check `specs/003-database-foundation/` for requirements
408: 2. **Create Model:** Add `Model_NewEntity.cs` in `Models/Receiving/`
409: 3. **Create DAO:** Add `Dao_NewEntity.cs` (Instance) in `Data/Receiving/`
410: 4. **Create Service Interface:** Add `IService_NewFeature.cs` in `Contracts/Services/`
411: 5. **Implement Service:** Add `Service_NewFeature.cs` in `Services/Receiving/`
412: 6. **Register Service:** Update `App.xaml.cs` ConfigureServices
413: 7. **Create ViewModel:** Add `NewFeatureViewModel.cs` (partial) in `ViewModels/Receiving/`
414: 8. **Register ViewModel:** Update `App.xaml.cs` ConfigureServices
415: 9. **Create View:** Add `NewFeatureView.xaml` in `Views/Receiving/`
416: 10. **Build & Test:** Run `dotnet build && dotnet test`
417: 11. **Update Spec:** Mark tasks complete in `specs/003-database-foundation/tasks.md`
418: 
419: ## Common Pitfalls to Avoid
420: 
421: |  Wrong |  Correct |
422: |---------|-----------|
423: | `public class MyViewModel : BaseViewModel` | `public partial class MyViewModel : BaseViewModel` |
424: | `<TextBox Text="{Binding MyProperty}" />` | `<TextBox Text="{x:Bind ViewModel.MyProperty, Mode=TwoWay}" />` |
425: | `throw new Exception("Not found");` (in DAO) | `return Model_Dao_Result.Failure("Not found");` |
426: | `string sql = "INSERT INTO packages...";` | `await Helper_Database_StoredProcedure.ExecuteNonQueryAsync("sp_insert_package", params);` |
427: | `var service = new MyService();` | `constructor: IMyService service` (DI) |
428: | Writing to Infor Visual database | Only SELECT queries on Infor Visual |
429: 
430: ## Quick Reference Commands
431: 
432: ```powershell
433: # Build solution
434: dotnet build
435: 
436: # Run all tests
437: dotnet test
438: 
439: # Run specific test class
440: dotnet test --filter "FullyQualifiedName~Dao_ReceivingPackage_Tests"
441: 
442: # Clean build artifacts
443: dotnet clean
444: 
445: # Restore NuGet packages
446: dotnet restore
447: 
448: # View DI registrations (check App.xaml.cs)
449: # No command - manually review ConfigureServices method
450: 
451: # Database connection test
452: mysql -h localhost -P 3306 -u root -p mtm_receiving_application -e "SELECT 1;"
453: ```
454: 
455: ---
456: 
457: **Remember:** This is a manufacturing application with strict data integrity requirements. Always follow MVVM patterns, never write to Infor Visual, and ensure all database operations use stored procedures. When in doubt, read the constitution and specification files first.

406:     /// <summary>

408:     /// </summary>
409:     /// <param name="args"></param>
410:     protected override async void OnLaunched(LaunchActivatedEventArgs args)
411:     {
412:         var startupService = _host.Services.GetRequiredService<IService_OnStartup_AppLifecycle>();
413:         await startupService.StartAsync();
414: 
415:         // Subscribe to session events
416:         var sessionManager = _host.Services.GetRequiredService<IService_UserSessionManager>();
417:         sessionManager.SessionTimedOut += OnSessionTimedOut;
418: 
419:         if (MainWindow != null)
420:         {
421:             MainWindow.Closed += OnMainWindowClosed;
422:         }
423:     }
424: 
425:     private void OnSessionTimedOut(object? sender, Model_SessionTimedOutEventArgs e)
426:     {
427:         // Close application on timeout
428:         // In a real app, we might show a dialog or navigate to login
429:         MainWindow?.Close();
430:     }
431: 
432:     private async void OnMainWindowClosed(object sender, WindowEventArgs args)
433:     {
434:         var sessionManager = _host.Services.GetRequiredService<IService_UserSessionManager>();
435:         await sessionManager.EndSessionAsync("manual_close");
436:     }

438:     /// <summary>

440:     /// </summary>

442:     /// <returns>The requested service</returns>
443:     /// <exception cref="InvalidOperationException">Thrown if the service is not found</exception>
444:     public static T GetService<T>() where T : class
445:     {
446:         return ((App)Current)._host.Services.GetService<T>()
447:             ?? throw new InvalidOperationException($"Service {typeof(T)} not found");

 81:         /// <summary>
 82:         /// Creates a new user account with validation.
 83:         /// </summary>
 84:         /// <param name="user">User model with account data</param>
 85:         /// <param name="createdBy">Windows username of account creator</param>
 86:         /// <returns>Result containing new employee number or error</returns>
 87:         public virtual async Task<Model_Dao_Result<int>> CreateNewUserAsync(Model_User user, string createdBy)
 88:         {
 89:             try
 90:             {
 91:                 await using var connection = new MySqlConnection(_connectionString);
 92:                 await connection.OpenAsync();
 93: 
 94:                 await using var command = new MySqlCommand("sp_Auth_User_Create", connection)
 95:                 {
 96:                     CommandType = CommandType.StoredProcedure
 97:                 };
 98: 
 99:                 // Input parameters
100:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_employee_number", user.EmployeeNumber);
101:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_windows_username", user.WindowsUsername);
102:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_full_name", user.FullName);
103:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_pin", user.Pin);
104:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_department", user.Department);
105:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_shift", user.Shift);
106:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_created_by", createdBy);
107:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_visual_username", user.VisualUsername ?? (object)DBNull.Value);
108:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@p_visual_password", user.VisualPassword ?? (object)DBNull.Value);
109: 
110:                 // Output parameters
111:                 var errorMessageParam = new MySqlParameter("@p_error_message", MySqlDbType.VarChar, 500)
112:                 {
113:                     Direction = ParameterDirection.Output
114:                 };
115:                 command.Parameters.Add(errorMessageParam);
116: 
117:                 await command.ExecuteNonQueryAsync();
118: 
119:                 // Check for errors
120:                 var errorMessage = errorMessageParam.Value?.ToString();
121:                 if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(errorMessage))
122:                 {
123:                     return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>(errorMessage);
124:                 }
125: 
126:                 // Return the employee number that was provided
127:                 // Defaults are seeded server-side by sp_Auth_User_Create -> sp_Auth_User_SeedDefaultModes.
128:                 // Extra safety: best-effort call in case the DB procedure set isn't deployed yet.
129:                 try
130:                 {
131:                     await Helper_Database_StoredProcedure.ExecuteNonQueryAsync(
132:                         _connectionString,
133:                         "sp_Auth_User_SeedDefaultModes",
134:                         new Dictionary<string, object>
135:                         {
136:                             { "user_id", user.EmployeeNumber }
137:                         });
138:                 }
139:                 catch
140:                 {
141:                     // Swallow: defaults are non-critical and must not block first run.
142:                 }
143: 
144:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Success<int>(user.EmployeeNumber);
145:             }
146:             catch (MySqlException ex)
147:             {
148:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>($"Database error: {ex.Message}", ex);
149:             }
150:             catch (Exception ex)
151:             {
152:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<int>($"Unexpected error: {ex.Message}", ex);
153:             }
154:         }

162:         /// <summary>
163:         /// Checks if a Windows username is unique across all users.
164:         /// </summary>
165:         /// <param name="username">Windows username to check</param>
166:         /// <param name="excludeEmployeeNumber">Optional employee number to exclude from check</param>
167:         /// <returns>Result indicating if username is unique</returns>
168:         public virtual async Task<Model_Dao_Result<bool>> IsWindowsUsernameUniqueAsync(string username, int? excludeEmployeeNumber = null)
169:         {
170:             try
171:             {
172:                 await using var connection = new MySqlConnection(_connectionString);
173:                 await connection.OpenAsync();
174: 
175:                 var query = excludeEmployeeNumber.HasValue
176:                     ? "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM auth_users WHERE windows_username = @username AND employee_number != @excludeId"
177:                     : "SELECT COUNT(*) FROM auth_users WHERE windows_username = @username";
178: 
179:                 await using var command = new MySqlCommand(query, connection);
180:                 command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@username", username);
181: 
182:                 if (excludeEmployeeNumber.HasValue)
183:                 {
184:                     command.Parameters.AddWithValue("@excludeId", excludeEmployeeNumber.Value);
185:                 }
186: 
187:                 var count = Convert.ToInt32(await command.ExecuteScalarAsync());
188:                 var isUnique = count == 0;
189: 
190:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Success<bool>(isUnique);
191:             }
192:             catch (MySqlException ex)
193:             {
194:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<bool>($"Database error: {ex.Message}", ex);
195:             }
196:             catch (Exception ex)
197:             {
198:                 return Model_Dao_Result_Factory.Failure<bool>($"Unexpected error: {ex.Message}", ex);
199:             }
